loans.name: Diaz Gonzalez Aida Luz

texts.es:
Ella es Aida es una empresaria de admirar, una mujer que tiene un negocio de tienda de productos de la canasta familiar el cual fundo pro necesidad económica y que con esfuerzo, sudor, mucho trabajo y sueños ha ido creciendo poco a poco, ella tuvo un préstamo inicial en interactuar el cual pago con puntualidad y le sirvió para surtir y comprar el enfriador que ven en la foto.

Aida es muy sonriente ella quiere progresar y tener un medio de sostenimiento económico estable.

Aida quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con granos, productos de refrigeración como carnes frías, lácteos, refrescos, abarrotes entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Aida is an admirable entrepreneur.  She has a grocery store that she established out of economic necessity, and through effort, sweat and hard work has realized her dreams little by little.  Her first loan was through Interactuar and she repaid it promptly.  It allowed her to buy a refrigerated display case and inventory as shown in the photo.

Aida is very cheerful and wants to prosper and have a stable economy to support herself.

The loan she is requesting is to buy grains, groceries and refrigerated goods such as cold meats, dairy products, soft drinks, etc.

loans.use: To buy grains, groceries and refrigerated goods such as cold meats, dairy products, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Elois De Jesus

texts.es:
Elois de Jesús es un pequeño cafetalero del norte de Nicaragua. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la producción de café como principal actividad económica, logrando integrarse al proceso de certificación de comercio justo.

Este joven emprendedor cursó hasta 2 grado de primaria y cada día se esfuerza  para mejorar sus condiciones económicas. Para él la mejora continua es muy importante para mejorar la productividad de su finca. Por tal razón está solicitando un financiamiento para garantizar las actividades de mejora y mantenimiento de sus plantaciones y lograr una buena cosecha este ciclo.

El principal reto para Elois de Jesús, hasta ahora han sido las enfermedades que enfrentan las plantaciones de café, pero está seguro que con la aplicación oportuna de insumos, y la puesta en práctica de las recomendaciones del equipo técnico que lo apoya, podrá salir adelante y tener mejores resultados.
texts.en:
Elois de Jesus is a small coffee producer in northern Nicaragua.  For four years he has been growing coffee as his main source of income, and has been able to integrate his business in the fair trade certification process.

This young man only received a second grade education and every day he makes an effort to improve his economy.  Continued improvement is very important to him regarding productivity on his plantation.  Therefore he is requesting a loan to guarantee activities related to maintenance and improvement of his plantations to obtain a good harvest this season.

The main challenge Elois de Jesus has faced until now is plant disease among his coffee crops.  But he is sure that by applying supplies in time and by using the recommendations of a technical team that supports him he will be able to ahead and obtain better results.

loans.use: To care for and improve his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Saint Bathelemy Group

texts.fr:
Fati est une femme âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 5 enfants. Elle est dans le domaine de la transformation alimentaire il y a 4 ans. la qualité des ses produits est sa force. Elle travaille bien et avec beaucoup de soins ce qui rend très propre son travail. La probabilité de sa réussit est lié a son professionnalisme dans son activité. Fati est une bonne cliente de ACFIME. Elle respecte ses engagements.
Fati utilisera le crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de pâte de manioc qu'elle va stocker et transformer au fur et à mesure en attièké. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer son activité mais aussi de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fati is 44 years old. She is a married mother to five children. Four years ago, she started working in food production. She has been successful in this trade thanks to the quality of her food and the effort she has displayed. She takes great care in what she does, which is reflected in her work.Her success is linked to her professionalism. Fati has been a good client to ACFIME and she respects her responsibilities.

Fati will use this loan to purchase 10 bags of cassava pulp which she will stock and gradually turn into attiéké, a typical West African side dish. After selling her wares, she will have made enough profit to allow her to carry on her business and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase cassava pulp to turn into attiéké, a typical West African side dish

loans.name: Maguette's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis juillet 2011,rassemble ces trois membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Rouguiyatou qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est mariée,est âgée de 45 ans et mére de 08 enfants dont 06 garçons.

Elle tient une boutique au niveau de son village et elle vend du riz,de l'huile,du sucre,du savon,du mil.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 10 sacs de riz à 13000f le sac,05 bidons d'huile à 16000f le bidon,05 cartons de savon à 4000f le carton,05 sacs de mil à 10000f le sac,01 sac de sucre à 25000f et divers produits comme le café,le thé,le lait pour une valeur de 10000f.

Son objectif est de consolider son activité et renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
This group, created in July 2011, brings together three members who live in the same village and who run retail businesses.

Rouguiyatou, the woman to the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group representative. She is a 45-year-old married mother to eight children, six boys and two girls. She has her own stall in the village and sells rice, oil, sugar, soap and millet.

With this loan, she is planning to purchase 10 bags of rice at 13,000 CFA per bag, five containers of oil at 16,000 CFA per container, five boxes of soap at 4000 CFA per box, five bags of millet at 10,000 CFA per bag and one bag of sugar for 25,000 CFA, as well as various other products such as coffee, tea and milk for a total of 10,000 CFA.

Her goal is to strengthen her business and increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soap, millet, oil and sugar

loans.name: Lidia Arminda

texts.es: Lidia tiene 40 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 22 y 18 años de edad, y es por ello que pone todo su esfuerzo para que estudien. En su comunidad y con sus amistades Lidia ofrece sus productos de belleza, los cuales adquiere por catálogo, lo que le permite sacar adelante a su familia desde hace 13 años y es gracias a su experiencia que cada día cuenta con más clientes que solicitan sus productos. Lidia está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cremas, lociones, joyería fina, champú, cremas para el rostro, lápiz para ojo, lápiz labial, maquillaje, etc. para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Lidia is 40 years old and lives in her own house along with her husband and her two daughters, who are 22 and 18 years old and it is for them that she works hard so they can get an education. In her community and among her friends, Lidia sells beauty products which she acquires through a catalog which has allowed her to get her family ahead for the last 13 years and thanks to her experience she has more customers each day who request her products. Lidia is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in creams, lotions, fine jewelry, shampoo, face creams, eye makeup, lipstick, makeup, etc. to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to invest in creams, lotions, fine jewelry, face creams, eye makeup, lipstick, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo es un productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua, dedicado a la producción de café desde hace más de 15 años. Es conocido en su comunidad como un hombre honesto y comprometido con su trabajo.

El ciclo pasado su cosecha se vio en riesgo debido a la afectación de la roya en su plantación, siendo su producción 30% menor al ciclo anterior. Para hacer frente a la afectación de esta plaga y lograr un mejor rendimiento en su cosecha, para este año él está solicitando un financiamiento para la adquisición de fertilizantes y abonos que le ayudarán a cumplir con la meta que se ha propuesto.

Este emprendedor ha trabajado con el apoyo del equipo técnico de la asociación, un plan de mejoramiento nutricional para sus cafetos, a fin de aumentar los niveles de producción de su café. Él está seguro que con un manejo adecuado, logrará tener una mejor cosecha y mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jairo is a producer from the northern area of Nicaragua who has been dedicated to the production of coffee for more than 15 years. He is known in his community as an honest man committed to his work.

In the last cycle, his harvest was at risk due to the involvement of rust on his plantation, resulting in 30% less production the previous cycle. To confront this plague and achieve better performance with his harvest, this year he is requesting a loan to acquire chemical and organic fertilizers which will help him with the goal that he has proposed.

This entrepreneur has worked with the support of the technical team of the association on a nutritional improvement plan for his coffee trees to increase production levels of his coffee. He is sure that with adequate management, he will obtain a better harvest and greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy organic or chemical fertilizers that he will apply to his coffee crop to obtain a good harvest.

loans.name: Shirley Maria Esther

texts.es: La señora Shirley trabaja desde muy joven, comenzó con su negocio hace cinco años atrás después de haber llevado varias actividades que le permitieron salir adelante, luego del abandono de su esposo comenzó con un capital mínimo al día de hoy y gracias a su esfuerzo y perseverancia cuenta con un puesto de venta de golosinas en un kiosco dentro de una escuela donde realiza su actividad de manera permanente y segura; en la escuela vende a más de trescientos estudiantes actividad que le permite vivir de manera digna con su hijo que asiste al colegio. El dinero que necesita es para la compra de mercadería para su tienda lo que le permitirá abastecer su kiosco para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes e incrementar sus ingresos, de esta forma ira mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su hijo a quien le desea un futuro mejor
texts.en: Shirley has worked since she was very young. She started her business five years ago after having done various activities that allowed her to get ahead. After her husband abandoned her, she started with minimum capital. Today, thanks to her hard work and perseverance, she has a stall where she sells snacks in a kiosk inside a school. Her activity is permanent and secure. In the school she sells to more than three hundred students. This activity allows her to live in a dignified manner with her son, who is in high school. She needs the money to buy merchandise for her store, which will allow her to stock her kiosk to meet the demand of her customers and increase her income. This way, she will improve her and her son's quality of life. She wants a better future for him.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store which will allow her to stock her kiosk to meet the demand of her customers and increase her income.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: La Señora Benedicta y su esposo, viven en Cochabamba provincia chapare;  tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, ambos económicamente son independientes, se dedican a la actividad de agricultura siembran papa, locoto y zapallo, para la venta de sus productos cuentan con un mercado consolidado, actualmente la señora solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono orgánico, semilla de papa y productos agroquímicos, debido a que sus ahorros lo invirtieron en la compra de ganado vacuno y ya no tienen dinero para realizar estas compras, con esto la señora podrá incrementar su producción y mejorar su ingresos para cambiar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Benedicta and her husband live in Cochabamba chapare province. She is 27 years old and married. Both are economically independent. They are dedicated to farming, planting potato, peppers and pumpkin. To sell their products, they use a consolidated market. Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer, potato seed and agrochemical products since she invested her savings in the purchase of cattle and she does not have the money to make these purchases. With this, she will be able to increase her production and improve her income to change her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, potato seed and agrochemical products to increase her production and improve her income.

loans.name: Mariposa Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 41 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 11 años, y su negocio es la confección de sábanas.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, comprometida con su trabajo, leal, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’, dónde hicieron su hogar los damnificados del desborde del río, situado a 12 kilómetros del centro de la ciudad. Los pobladores llegaron de las provincias y el resto del país y se asentaron en esta zona que hoy tiene más del 20% del total de la población, Es el distrito más pobre. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo hasta la altura de los hombros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada a la derecha, viste polera amarilla). Su vida la realiza junto a su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la impulsaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de productos nutricionales, venta de jugos naturales, panadería, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de cubiertas de celulares, venta de hoja de coca y venta de helado, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la confección de sábanas; ella se encarga de comprar tela por mayor con diseños, texturas y de diferentes calidades para confeccionar sabanas de todo tamaño como; de 1 plaza, de plaza y media, 2 plazas y King size, “El juego de Sábana generalmente está compuesto de tres piezas: esquinero, sábana y fundas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que por el clima cálido del lugar sólo se usan sábanas como ropa de cama eso logra generar buenas ventas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de tela por cortes. Su sueño es abrir un puesto de venta fijo de ropa de cama, ella desea realizar la compra de tela por mayor para la confección de sábanas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por mayor para confeccionar sábanas y abrir un puesto de venta de ropa de cama.
texts.en:
Maria is a 41 year old woman. She is single and has an 11 year old son. Her business is making sheets. She is a good mother who is enterprising, dedicated to her work, loyal, responsible and very hardworking. She runs her business in the ‘Plan 3000’ area where the victims of a river flood have made their homes. It is 12 kilometers from the town center. The residents arrived from the provinces and other parts of the country and established this area, which today has 20% of the total population. It is the poorest district. It has a warm, sub-tropical climate with a temperature that varies between 21-35 degrees celsius.  

Maria has dark skin, brown eyes, long, black hair that reaches her shoulders, short stature, and a robust build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish in the general culture and for her business. She is seated on the right, wearing a yellow t-shirt. She lives her life with her son, who is in school. They live in a home of their own built from wood with a metal sheeting roof and a brick floor. It has potable water, electricity, and plumbing. Her desire to get ahead drove her to lead a bank of people with businesses such as: selling nutritional products, selling natural juices, a bread bakery, selling second hand clothes, selling cell phone cases, selling coca leaves and selling ice cream. This was to ask for a loan and improve their activities. Her business is making sheets. She buys fabric wholesale with designs, textures and of different qualities to make sheets in al sizes such as twin, full, queen and king. “A set of sheets is generally made up of three pieces: fitted, flat sheet and pillowcases," she remarks. The advantage of her business is that due to the warm climate people just use sheets as their bedding and this leads to good sales. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy fabric to use. Her dream is to open a permanent sales stall for the bedding. She wants to buy fabric wholesale to make the sheets. This is her first loan cycle with the institution during the 3 years she has been doing this activity. 

These are the reasons why Maria is asking for a loan to buy fabric wholesale to make sheets and open a sales stall for bedding.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale to make sheets and open a stall to sell bedding.

loans.name: Truhlaya Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras (Natividad, Florens y Gregoria), pertenecen a la etnia miskita de  la comunidad de TRUHLAYA, que se localiza a 55 kilómetros de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron recientemente, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeños negocios de crianza y comercialización de cerdos, incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios. El nombre del Grupo Solidario es en lengua mískita que significa pez carete que vive en los cayos.

Natividad: Es una señora amable, coordinadora del grupo solidario con cualidades de líder y deseo de superación, tiene 34 años de edad, casada con 6 hijos adolecentes y menores de edad que cursan su primaria y secundaria. Su esposo trabaja como agricultor. Con el propósito de apoyar con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, solicita su primer financiamiento para iniciar su pequeño negocio de crianza de cerdos, comercialización y venta de carne de cerdo en sus diversas variedades: Chicharron, moronga, chorizo, charrazca. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three hard working women (Natividad, Florens and Gregoria). They belong to the miskita ethnicity from the Truhlaya community that is located 55 km from Bilwi, a town in Puerto Cabezas. They organized recently with the purpose of accessing a loan to improve their small businesses raising and selling pigs, to increase their income, to improve their living conditions, to be able to cover the basic needs of their home, to assure the education of their children and to expand their businesses. The name Grupo Solidario is in the miskita language that means carete fish that lives in the keys.

Natividad is a friendly woman and the coordinator of the unified group with qualities of leadership and a desire to succeed. She is 34 years old, married with six adolescent and young children that are in primary and secondary school. Her husband works as a farmer. With the goal of supporting the home expenses and her children's education, she is requesting her first loan to start her small business raising and selling pigs and selling pork in its diverse forms: chicharron, blood sausage, chorizo, charrazca. She dreams of being a successful vendor.

loans.use: to buy, feed and sell pigs.

loans.name: Nurkan

texts.ru: Нуркан, 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Нуркан- среднее образование, вместе с мужем она занимается животноводством. Дети всячески помогают по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду Нуркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 14,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, Нуркан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Нуркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nurkan is 46 years old, married, and is raising five children with her spouse. Nurkan has secondary education, and together with her husband she works in animal husbandry. Their children help around the farm in every way possible. 

Thanks to Nurkan's persistent hard work, today on her farm there are three cows and ten sheep. The monthly income is 14,500 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her business, Nurkan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) in order to buy livestock feed. Nurkan plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio is an artisan from Peru who specializes in mate gourd ornaments and décor. He has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is Emilio’s story:

“I was born in Huancayo, Peru. This art is in my blood. It's something that is born from generation to generation, carried by a magical world toward natural materials. Through my own initiative and desire to learn, my eyes saw and my hands created. This is how I began in this wonderful world, trying to create and create. I am very happy and grateful for this microcredit. With these funds, I will be able to buy material and create more items in time for the holiday season.”

Emilio is requesting a loan to invest in the bulk purchase of raw materials, including dried gourds. Use the link below to view his mate gourd ornaments and décor on the NOVICA site: http://novica.com/kiva/6001.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in bulk

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 36 years old and married with two children. For the past 11 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling food and dried fish. Marilyn has borrowed and repaid 26 previous loans through NWTF. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Marilyn is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase household goods to sell

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema is 48 years old. She is married with two children who are in college and she lives in Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Gema is a rice farmer and she earns well for her family. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2002 and is thankful that it has been her constant financing partner.

Gema is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy seedlings, sacks of fertilizer and chemicals, and to plow her rice field. She is a hardworking mother and will use her loan to meet her children’s school needs. Gema hopes to see her children earn their diplomas one day so they can have comfortable lives.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, chemicals, and to plow her rice field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: creams, lotions, soaps, natural medicines and other products in order to improve her sales and profits

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 50 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are in school. Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. 

Lucia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

In the future Lucia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, a mother of six children between the ages of 2 months and 18, is dedicated to providing for her family. She currently works as a virtual assistant and her husband works as a TSA agent. 

Sarah has been researching different business markets to supplement her household’s income. She was interested in starting a business in which she could bring in additional earnings while still being able to spend time with her children. She also wanted the business to be home-based and family-oriented.

It was then that Sarah found the children’s party rental industry and saw a huge potential. The jumper and bouncer rental industry is booming for children’s birthday parties. In addition, the weather in San Diego makes it a great location for outdoor parties year-round. 

Sarah will use her $2,000 Kiva loan to purchase two jumpers to rent for children’s parties. Sarah will focus on attracting new customers and coordinating the rental of the jumpers for the business. Her husband will be helping her with the set up and delivery of the jumpers.

loans.use: to purchase two jumpers to rent for children’s parties.

loans.name: Cesia Group

texts.es:
¨Grupo Cesia¨, esta integrando por tres mujeres, orgullosas de ayudar en los gastos y en las mejoras economicas de su hogar. Dedicandose a diferentes actividades comerciales, solicitan por 4 vez credito a ADIM, para seguir impulsando sus negocios. 
El grupo esta coordinado por Yessica de 22 años,acompañada, tiene un hijo de 7 años quien actualmente cursa la primaria, y un hijo de 2 años. Desde hace siete años se dedica a la preparación y venta de tortillas y leña en su domicilio, su mama le ayuda palmeando las tortillas y en la venta del producto. Con el crédito invertirá en la compra de Leña, maíz y frijol. Con las ganancias ahorradas tiene pensado cumplir con el pago de las cuotas y engrandecer su negocio y ampliar su casa.
Las otras integrantes son Francina de 27 años, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de calzado en su domicilio. Y Angela de 41 años, ofrece el servicio de comida fritanguera en su domicilio.
texts.en:
¨Grupo Cesia¨ is comprised of three women who are proud to help out with the household costs and economic improvement of their households. They each make their living in different ways, and are asking for a loan from ADIM for the fourth time, in order to further boost their businesses. 

The group is coordinated by Yessica, who is 22, in a relationship, and has a seven-year-old son who is currently at primary school, and another who is two years old. For seven years she has been making and selling tortillas and firewood in her home. Her mother helps her to hand-roll the tortillas and to sell the product. With her portion of the loan she will buy firewood, corn and beans. With the earnings that she saves up she plans to fulfil her payment instalments, expand her business and make her house bigger. 

The other members are: Francina, who is 27 and makes a living making and selling footwear in her home; and Angela, who is 41 and runs a fried food service in her home.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and beans

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 44 years old, married and a resident of Lusot, Baliangao Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is a responsible family provider. 

He is a farmer and has a farm of his own where he plants fruits and vegetables. The family has met many challenges with their business, but they realize that it is good to face challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Joseph wants to increase sales. Recently, he has requested from Paglaum MPC a loan that will help him to meet their budget in purchasing seeds, fertilizers and other items needed to continue their farming and to save more for the educational needs for their children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other items needed for the farm.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Remedios earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional linen, threads, needles, etc for her tailoring business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional linen, threads, needles, etc. for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Guzal

texts.en:
Guzal is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1985 and is married with one child. Her husband is an emigrant. Until, his husband come back, she had to do business and feed her child. 

She participated at a three day training provided by IMON for start up clients. After training she had a plan to serve Tajik women by making traditional dresses. She requested a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy a new sewing machine and textiles to sew traditional women dresses. 

She hopes to be supported and hopes her business will help her to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and textile for traditional women's dresses

loans.name: Kasoga Tweyombeke Group

texts.en:
Geresomu is a sixty year old hardworking man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming as his main source of income. He also practices goat rearing to earn extra income. He started this business with the intention of educating his children. He faces poor climatic changes that affect his plantations and price fluctuations as his main challenges though he hopes to grow and have increased profits from his farming.
 
He is requesting for a loan to pay workers who are ploughing his land and to buy more seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to pay workers who are ploughing his gardens and buy more seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Tuzamurane  Group 1 Didacienne

texts.en:
Didacienne is a group leader; aged 26 years.She is married with 2 children aged 2 and 3 years. The group is called TUZAMURANE means “SUPPORT EACH OTHER” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She has a shop and has been running in a business for 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, soap and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to buy medical insurance.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, soap and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is a 50 years old married man, from village Dighomi, Tbilisi district. He has wife, son and daughter, who is the only breadwinner in the family. Koba's daughter works as a sales lady at the local fruits and vegetables store. The family members find it really hard to keep financial stability. 

Koba wants to do his bit for the family's welfare and start his own business, as he was unable to start any stable job. The local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Koba’s credit requests were rejected several times, as he was unable to satisfy their requirements. He received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.
 
Koba will purchase a second-hand car with the requested amount and will start serving local people as a taxi driver. He will become the main breadwinner in the family, as the business is warranted and profitable activity in the region. 

The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased,  thanks to  Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start taxi business to be able to support his family

loans.name: Izo

texts.en:
Izo lives in the Gardabani region of Eastern Georgia with her husband. They have two sons and a daughter. She had a job at the local kindergarten, but she had to give it up due to an illness. 

As the family needed a new source of income, they started farming on a small scale. Izo currently keeps one milk cow. She enjoys her new occupation.

With the help of the loan, she will buy another full-grown milk cow and calves. It is important to buy a local breed adapted to the climate. They can cope with the hot and dry summers easily.

Izo makes delicious traditional "Sulguni" cheese from the milk and sells it locally.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow and calves for her little farm to make more cheese for the local market.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Merla works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Merla is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing nets, bamboo, wood for her fishing business.

Merla has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to to buy a big boat.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing nets, bamboo, wood for fishing

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 32 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование. Гулмира работает уборщицей, также в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством. Стартовав 5 лет назад с 10,000 сомов (KGS), ее трудолюбие и упорство позволили развить свой бизнес до ежемесячной совокупной прибыли в размере 10,600 сомов (KGS). В хозяйстве Гулмиры есть 5 коров. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулмира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulmira is 32 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has a secondary education. Gulmira works as a cleaner, and she also rears animals to get income for her family. Having started five years ago with 10,000 som (KGS), her hard work and dedication have enabled her to develop her business to a monthly gross profit of 10,600 som (KGS). Gulmira's farm has five cows. In order to develop her business further, Gulmira has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep for fattening and resale. Gulmira plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in developing her business.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old, married and blessed with three children.  She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 so as to benefit from from the trainings especially enterprise development.

Her economic activity is dairy and vegetable farming. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds and milking cans. This will boost dairy farming business for increased income to provide better food, clothing and shelter for her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds and milking cans hence boost her dairy farming business for increased income to provide better food, clothing and shelter for her family.

loans.name: Baon's Group

texts.en:
Baon is ages 29 years old and a mother of two children who are all dependent child and in school, living in Siem Reap province. Nowadays, she grows rice on a hectare farmland as the main source of her family’s income. In addition, feeding two pigs for sale is an additional source of her income. She has been involved in these businesses for ages and it earns her about 22,200KHR per day. 

This is her third loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farming. She hopes to gain more yields than last years through this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farming

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Cham province, Chanthy is 54 years old and a mother of five children. Nowadays she grows cassava and rubber plants as the main sources of her family’s income and selling grocery items is the additional source for her to earn extra income for thirty-six years. Due to the depreciated of the rubber price on the market and having not enough rain for her crops since last year, she is now facing with a problem of having not enough funds to do the farm again.  

Now Chanthy decides to lead a group to take a new loan via VisionFund. She has been with VisionFund for three cycles already and completely paid back her loans successfully. The previous loan helps her to be better off than before. 

For this new loan, she is willing to take her portion to buy cassava seeds, pesticide and pay for plowing fees. She hopes her farm will get extra yields to improve her family.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds, pesticide and pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sothy's Group

texts.en:
Living in Kampong Cham province, Sothy is 27 years old and has five children; only three of them are in school and others are too young to attend school. The sources of her family income are from cassava farming and working on other farms for a fee.  She can earn about 39,800KHR per day to support her family’s living. 

Sothy has been with VisionFund Kiva’s partner for three cycle already and completely repaid back the loans. Due to lack of fund, Sothy is leading a group of three members to apply for a loan via VisionFund. She will manage her loan portion to buy more farmland and pay the labor fees to support her cassava plantation. She hopes her family will have a better living condition through this loan.

loans.use: to buy more farmland and pay the labor fees to support her cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 40-year old father of 3, who does piece jobs at construction sites. He is a soft-spoken man who works hard to fend for his wife and children. 

Patrick is part of a self-help group that has decided to venture into business. The group is building an abattoir in their community to slaughter and package livestock, ranging from chicken to cattle and goats. He is therefore requesting for a loan to purchase a giblet cleaning table. 

The abattoir will employ members of the neighborhood who will package and supply meat across the area.

loans.use: to buy a galvanized giblet cleaning table to make jobs in the area

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn works hard to support her family. Jennelyn is married and has a internet cafe business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional computer and spare parts for her internet cafe.

Jennelyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer and spare parts for her internet cafe

loans.name: Toun's Group

texts.en: Toun is 57 years old and a mother of four children, two of whom are dependent children; they live in Siem Reap province. Nowadays, she grows rice on 2.5 hectares of farmland as the main source of her family’s income. In addition, raising pigs for sale is an additional source of her income. She has been involved in these businesses for ages and it earns her about 18,000KHR per day. This is her fourth loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farming. She hopes to gain more yields than previous years through this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Pov is a 31-year-old mother of two children, one of them is in school while the other one is too young to attend school. They live in Pursat province. Growing rice is the main source of her family’s income and working on another farm for a fee is the additional source of income for her. She has been involved in these businesses for ages and it earns her about 54,800KHR per day. Due to the depreciation of market prices for rice, and last year's poor crop, she is now lacking of funds to do farming. Pov is leading a group to apply for a new loan via VisionFund to buy household supplies for her family’s uses. This is the first loan cycle for her and she hopes that this loan will help her to have a better living condition and have enough household supplies.

loans.use: to buy household supplies for her family.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha is a 50-year-old mother of five children, only two among them are in school. They live in Kratie province. The sources of her family’s living are from growing rice and selling Khmer cake. She has been involved in these businesses for thirty-two years and it earns her about 30,000KHR per day. This is the sixth loan cycle for her while the other one in her group is on the third loan cycle. The previous loan helped her to have a better living conditions.

Due to her crop not growing well last year, it caused her to have too few funds to do farming in this season. Because of that, she is now leading a group of two to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fee. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income through gaining more yields and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Sok Eang's Group

texts.en:
Nowadays Sok Eang lives in Kampong Cham province; she is 52-year-old and a mother of three children. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and growing cassava. Growing pepper and working on other farms for fees are additional sources to earn extra income, for thirty-four years. Her daily income is about 125,600KHR per day to support her family. 

Because of not having enough rain, her cassava crops did not grow well, which caused her to lack funds for farming. Due to this reason, she is now leading a group of five to apply for a new loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The previous loans helped her to have a better living condition and for this new loan, she will spend to buy seeds, pesticide and pay for plowing fees. 

Sok Eang hopes that she could earn more income and will have enough ability to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticide and pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is a 48-year-old farmer, living in a remote area Kampong Cham province. She has three dependent children and two of them are in school while the other one is too young to attend school. Nowadays she grows sugar cane for supporting her lifestyle for ages. Her daily income earn around 36,700KHR per day. 

She has been with VisionFund for two cycles already and has completely paid back loans. That loan helps her family to have enough household supplies to use than before. Unfortunately, insect has destroyed her crop last year, which cause her to face a hard situation of lacking funds to do farming. 

Now, she is leading a group of two members to take a new Kiva loan. She will use her loan portion to buy seeds, pesticide and pay for plowing fees for her farming. She hopes to have enough ability to expand her business more to boost her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticide and pay the plowing fees for her farming

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Santi Pala Group

texts.en:
As expected, the current planting season coincides with the rainy season. The Santi Pala group plants corn and chilies. Receiving good care and supported by the right season, they harvest the maximum results and targets achieved. I Made, head of the group, feel very happy. Not only he succeed to manage his garden, but he is also happy because of all the members of the Santi Pala group he led got satisfactory results. 

To further improve the quality of their garden, Santi Pala group decided to apply for a loan again. These loans are used exclusively for the purchase of organic fertilizers, farming tools and superior quality seeds. They try to produce more quality products to obtain a satisfactory price market. 

With hard work and respect for each other, he hopes the planning of Santi Pala group to improve the quality of their garden will succeed.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, superior quality seeds and farming tools to grow corn and chillies

loans.name: Inelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Inelia, tiene 26 años y es soltera. Es una  joven emprendedora y trabajadora con muchos deseos de superación. Esta con ADIM por 4ta vez solicitando crédito para financiar su negocio de preparación y venta de revueltas y bollo. Quien se ha dedicado desde hace 16 años, y su mama le ayuda con la preparación del producto. Con el crédito aprobado invertirá en la compra de materiales de insumos como maíz, azúcar, queso, mantequilla, leña y hoja. Así aumentara la productividad y venderá mas a su clientela. Con el crédito anterior logro poner añadirle la venta de pan al negocio, así aumento sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Inelia is 26 years old and is single. She is a young, hardworking entrepreneur with a high desire to excel. This will be her 4th time requesting a loan through ADIM to finance her business in the preparation and sales of scrambled eggs and bread buns. She has worked at this for the last 16 years, and her mother helps with the preparation of the product.

With the approved loan, she will invest in the purchase of raw materials such as corn, sugar, cheese, butter, wood, and leaves in order to increase production and sales to more customers. With the previous loan she was able to add bread sales to the business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as corn, sugar, cheese, butter, wood, and leaves.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Mrs. Jean is 41 years old and lives in Southern Poblacion, Baliangao, Misamis Occodental Philippines. Jean has a poultry business and had this business for 4 years. Jean has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. 

Mrs. Jean through Pauglam PMPC has requested a loan to purchase 3 piglets & feeds. Now, she requests a loan of 7,000 PHP.  She really hopes & prays that her business would grow and benefit her family. 

Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To purchase 3 piglets & feeds.

loans.name: Sinceredad

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sinceridad works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Sinceridad is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of fish to make dried fish for her dried fish business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Sinceridad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to to add more capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Seng Heang's Group

texts.en:
Seng Heang lives in a remote area of the Kampong Cham province; she is 35 years old and has two children, one of them is in school while the other one is too young. For her living, she does rice farming to support her family for seventeen years. She could make about 51,400KHR per day from her business.

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one cycle already and fully paid back her loan successfully. That loan helps her to have sufficient household supplies to use. Due to the depreciation of the rice price, her incomes was decreased and caused her to have not enough funds to do farming this year. 

She has now decided to take a new loan via VisionFund. As the group leader, she will take the new loan to buy rice seed for her farming. She highly expects to her rice-paddy fields will gain her more yields than the previous year.

loans.use: to buy rice seed for her farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Cham province, Thea, 23 years old, is a young mother of a small child who is in school. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and working on other farm for fee around fifteen years. Her daily income is about 52,800KHR per day. However, her income was affected because of her rice-paddy field was destroyed by insects. 

Now Thea forming as a small group to apply for a new loan via VisionFund, this loan is her second loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. As the group leader, she will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that her farm will provide her better yields to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 48 years old and with five children, three of whom in school, Anne works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future Anne would like to save enough money for her family future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Tonh's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kratie province, Tonh is a 41-year-old mother of six children, two of whom are in school. The sources of her family’s income are from cassava growing, rice farming and working on another farm for a fee to support her family. She can earn about 97,200KHR per day.

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group of three members to take the first Kiva loan via VisionFund. As a group leader, she will manage her loan to buy pesticide and pay for labor fees. She hopes her business will earn her extra income and allow her to have the ability to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en: Ren is a 37-year-old mother of four children, living in Mondulkiri province. She has earned her income via growing cassava on four hectares of farmland and working on another farm for fee for around six years. For Ren, this is her second loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Because her cassava crop did not grow well last year, it caused her to have not enough funds to do farming again. So she decided to lead a group to take a new loan to solve this problem. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy cassava seeds. Ren hopes that her family’s living will get better through this loan.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of canned goods, milk, coffee, chips, candies, etc to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like boarding houses.

Phoebe dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, milk, coffee, chips, candies, etc to sell

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en:
A young single woman is 33-year-old, living in a remote area of the Kampong Cham province. Phoeun could earn income via cassava growing and selling grocery items to make more income for fifteen years. Nowadays, she earns about 43,100KHR per day for supporting her lifestyle. 

Unfortunately, last year insects destroyed her crops, which caused her family to face with the problem of lacking money to do the farm for this year.  

Now, she is leading a group of two members to take their first loan with VisionFund. She will spend her loan portion to purchase chicken feed and repair her chicken cage. She expects her family’s living will improve through this loan.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and repair her chicken cages

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Suta Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
Selection of appropriate seeds and supported by the right season make the Suta Pertiwi group obtain maximum results. Last season they grew corn. They took care of the corn very well, with fertilizer and sprayed with pesticide so the corn grew well and gave fruit as expected. 

I Wayan harvested corn on his land along with his wife and sold it. It got results sufficient to meet the needs of the family, for working capital and set aside for savings. He and his whole family is very happy. 1 members got the result more than the target, so he decided to continue the business with his own money. He conveyed gratitude and thanks for the support of the lenders, Kiva and MUK.

Entering the new agricultural season, the Suta Pertiwi group agreed to resume lending at MUK. This loan was used to purchase superior quality seeds, fertilizers and agricultural tools. I Wayan used the loan to buy fertilizer and superior quality seeds (superior quality seeds more resistant to diseases). His agricultural tools are still good and useable. He plans to save all the results from his garden and will use it to repair his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and superior quality seeds

loans.name: Phlern's Group

texts.en:
Phlern lives in a remote area of the Mondulkiri province. She is 41 years old and has six children; four of them are in school, while the other two are too young to attend school. 

Nowadays, she grows cassava and has worked on other farms to get a fee for six years. Her daily income is around 55,800 KHR per day. She has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle already and fully repaid back her loan. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group of three to take a new loan via VisionFund. She will manage her loan portion to buy cassava seeds for her farm. She hopes to gain yields to upgrade her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Sam An

texts.en:
Sam An is a young mother of two children who lives in a remote area of the Kratie province. Her age is 27 years old. The sources of her family’s income have been from rice farming and working on other farms for a fee for around 10 years. 

Through her businesses, Sam An could earn about 20,000 KHR per day. 

This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva partner. The previous loan helped her to have better living conditions. She will use her new loan portion to buy a hand tractor for plowing fields. She hopes to update her family’s living through this loan.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor for plowing the fields

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
A 61-year-old woman living in Kandal province, Sophat is a mother of six children. Nowadays, she does rice farming to support her family’s living. 

Sophat has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for five loan cycles already and fully repaid back her past loans. The previous loans helped her to have a better standard of living and have enough household supplies for her family’s use. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group of two members to take a new loan via VisionFund. She will manage her loan to buy farming supplies to do rice farming. She hopes that this loan will help her rice crop grow well and gain her more yields.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to do rice farming

loans.name: Sorl

texts.en:
Sorl is a mother of five children, and only two of them are in school. She is 43 years old and lives in the Bati district of the Takeo province. She earns income via growing rice on a hectare of farmland and works as a construction worker. 

For Sorl, she has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle already, and completely paid back the loan successfully. The previous loan helped her to have better living conditions and the ability to send her children to school. 

This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy a new motorbike for traveling to work. She hopes this loan will help to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Living in Kandal province, Sinat is 37 years old and has four children; only two of them are in school. Nowadays, she does rice farming as the main source of her family’s income, and has grown vegetables as an additional source to earn more income for 17 years. Her family’s income is about $16.22 USD per day. 

Due to her crop not growing well last year because insects destroyed her rice farm, she is now lacking funds to do farming again. Through this case, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund in order to spend on buying a new motorbike. 

Sinat hopes to improve her transportation for supporting her farming.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Sokhoeurm

texts.en:
Sokhoeurm has been working as an English teacher for three years. He is a 25-year-old single man and lives in a remote area of the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul’s district. 

Sokhoeurm is just with VisionFund for this cycle. He is seeking a loan to pay school fees to study English literature at a local university. 

He highly hopes that this loan will enable him to obtain a higher education background in order to end up with a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay school fees to study English literature at a local university.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed farming business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. Annabelle earns additional income from fishing.

She is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase seaweed seedlings for her seaweed farming business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and has now requested another loan to further build her businesses.  Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts along with the help of loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
Arcelita is 57 years old and widowed with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Arcelita has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a flower shop.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen works hard to support her family. Belen is married and has a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ready-to-wear to sell.

Belen has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Belen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, etc., for her seaweed farming business.

Cristina has been in this business for five years. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business and save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 57 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

Edna has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from seaweed farming and weaving mats.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Jackielyn works hard to support her family. She sells used clothing in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fishing.  Jackielyn is borrowing 15,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase additional used clothing to sell in her business.  Jackielyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothing to sell

loans.name: Nonalyn

texts.en:
Nonalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who is able to help her parent's generate a family income.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig fattening. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Nonalyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, etc.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Battambang province’s Sangke district, Pov is 52 years old and a widowed woman who has five children. For her living, she has done rice farming for 10 years. Her current business earns her about 42,200 KHR per day. 

This is Pov’s first loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the group leader, she will manage her loan portion to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland, and will use a portion of her loan to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes to extend her business to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Toreka

texts.en:
Toreka is a 42-year-old mother with six children. She runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches and toasted sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Toreka has requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, a container, butter and mayonnaise to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit.

She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, a container, butter and mayonnaise

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 45 years old with three children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Nila requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals to assist her in running the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosie is 39 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Rosie has a buying and selling of bananas business in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock of bananas to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. 

Rosie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of bananas to sell

loans.name: Susinia

texts.en:
Susinia works hard to support her family. Susinia is married and has a buying and selling of spices business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spices to sell.

Susinia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Susinia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices to sell

loans.name: Vengin

texts.en:
Vengin is 24 years old. With one child who is in school, Vengin works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

In the future, Vengin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Zaidy

texts.en:
Zaidy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Zaidy has been in this business for 10 years.

Zaidy requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and has now requested another loan to further build her business. 

In the future, Zaidy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en: Lim, 48, lives in Battambang Province. She is a mother of twelve children; only three of them are in school. The sources of her income are from cassava growing, rice farming, and occasionally from wage work. For the past 12 years, she has earned about 13,000 KHR per day. Lack of working capital to support her business is her main challenge. She has had four loans through VisionFund, and she has completely repaid these loans. She is now leading a group of two members to apply for another loan. Lim, who is the leader, will use her loan to buy cassava seeds and pay for labor fees for her cassava plantation. She hopes that this loan will help her to timely grow her cassava as well as her rice.

loans.use: to buy cassava seed and pay for labor fees for her cassava plantation

loans.name: Lus Amanda

texts.es: Doña Lus, de 52 años, casada, es una persona trabajadora, humilde y servicial con su clientela. Se dedica a la venta de plantas, desde hace 4 años y lo inicio con el dinero ahorrado de su trabajo anterior, tiene a su responsabilidad un hijo de 11 años y cursa la 5to grado de primaria. Es 1era. vez que solicita a ADIM crédito para su negocio, y requiere de el para invertirlo en la compra de abonos, venenos, manso y tierra. Procurando así que su negocio le sea bien productivo.
texts.en:
Doña Lus is 52 years old, married, a very hardworking, humble, person who is attentive to her clientele. She has made a living selling plants for 4 years and she started with the money she had saved from her previous job. She is responsible for one 11-year-old son who is in 5th grade. 

This is the first time she is requesting an ADIM loan for her business, and she needs it to invest in the purchase of fertilizer, insecticide, parcels of land and soil. If she is able to get it her business will be very productive.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, parcels, and soil.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan tiene 35 años de edad vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos el mayor de 3 años de edad y el menor de 9 meses, por lo cual se esfuerza mucho para llevar el sustento al hogar ya que él es un hombre muy trabajador. Juan se gana la vida en una empresa cercana a su vivienda lo que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar, pero además buscando la manera de obtener mejores ingresos económicos vende productos de belleza por catálogo.  Juan ha observado que cada día son más las personas que solicitan sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cremas para el cuerpo, cremas para el cabello, fragancias para damas y caballeros, champú, jabones, etc. para cumplir con la demanda de productos que solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old and lives in his own home together with his life partner and his two children. The older is 3 years old and the younger is 9 months old. For them he makes a great effort to support his home since he is a very hardworking man. 

Juan makes a living in a business near his house which allows him to support his family, but he is also looking for a way to make more income selling beauty products from a catalogue.  

Juan has observed that each day there are more people asking for his products, for this reason he is requestin a FUSAI loan to invest in body lotions, hair products, fragrances for women and men, shampoo, soaps, etc. to meet the demand for products his clients ask for.

loans.use: to invest in body lotions, hair products, fragrances for women and men, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Ziynat

texts.ru: Зийнат, 56 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей, уже есть внучка, ей 3 года. У Зийнат среднее образование. В поисках дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством, стартовав в 2012 году, благодаря упорному труду Зийнат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день на земельной доле мерою 1,29 Га она выращивает кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зийнат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян и обработку почвы для выращивания экологически чистой кукурузы. Доходы от кредита Зийнат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Ziynat is 56 and married with four children and a three-year-old granddaughter. She has a high school education and works in agriculture as a source of income for her family, a business she began in 2012. Thanks to her hard work she currently has 1.29 hectares of land where she grows corn for her own use and for sale. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Ziynat has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase fertilizers and seeds and to cultivate her land in order to grow organic corn. She plans to put profits from the loan toward further building up her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to cultivate her land in order to grow organic corn

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 56 years old and married with ten children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for ten years. She also earns additional income from general store. Lucia is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 54 años de edad , conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, domiciliada en CASERIO CULPON en el distrito NUEVA ARICA, la cual es una zona rural, que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, Costa Norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta al por menor de bebidas y tabaco hace 05 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio; solicita préstamo para comprar mercadería y aumentar su stock e invertir en arreglos en la infraestructura de su casa, esto le servira para tener una mejor aparaciencia de su negocio y una mayor atención de sus clientes, con la finalidad de poder satifacer los gustos de sus clientes y asi poder incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa, age 54, is in a common-law relationship, and she does not have children under her care.  She lives in her own house in the Culpon hamlet in the Nueva Arica district.  It is a rural area in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She has been selling drinks and tobacco for retail for five years.  The business is at her house.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, to increase her stock, and to invest in fixing the infrastructure of her house.  This will give her business a better appearance and more attention from her customers.  She will do this in order to be able to satisfy her customers’ preferences.  This way she will be able to increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, to increase her stock, and to invest in fixing the infrastructure of her house.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is 35 years old, married to Jane and supports a family of 3 children. He has been operating in motorcycle transport for the last 5 years earning KES8,000 per month. 

Lucas has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk with his motorcycle to the market for more income gain. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy land for rental construction. His future hopes and dreams are to financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk with his motorcycle to the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Aida  works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Aida is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to purchase fishing nets, bamboo, plastic wires, etc for her fishing business.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, bamboo, plastic wires, etc

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул, 31 год, замужем, есть дочь, учится в 4 классе. Нургул занимается торговлей на центральном рынке города, продает женскую и мужскую одежду, она самодостаточная и самостоятельная женщина. В обороте есть товар на сумму 150,000 сом (KGS). Супруг помогает в ведении животноводческой деятельности, в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 20 овец, 2 лошади. На ежедневной основе доят коров и продают молоко. Нургул, в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды для увеличения количества товара в обороте. Доходы от кредита Нургул вложит в расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Nurgul is 31 years old, married, and has a daughter in her fourth year of school. Nurgul trades at the central market in town. She sells women's and men's clothing. She is a self-sufficient and independent woman. She has goods in stock worth 150,000 som (KGS). Her husband helps her in rearing animals. They have two cows, twenty sheep and two horses. They milk the cows daily and sell milk. In order to develop her business further, Nurgul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy clothing to increase her stock of goods. Nurgul will invest the proceeds of the loan in expanding the business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the new season in order to increase the stock in her shop and attract new clients.

loans.name: Pak's Group

texts.en:
Pak is a 50-year-old mother of four children and only one of them is in school, living in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays she does rice farming and works on other farm for fee to support her family’s living for ages. She could earn around 35,800KHR per day. 

Pak has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and fully paid back the loan. The previous loan helped her to improve her family’s living condition. 

Due to lack of funds to expand her current business, she is now leading a group of four to take the new second Kiva loan via VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use it to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees for her farming.  She hopes this loan will help her to gain more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Srey Mao's Group

texts.en:
Srey Mao is 35 years old and the married mother of two children, one of them is in school while the other one is too young. She is a rice farmer on one-hectare of farmland and a paid worker, who live in Pursat province. She has been involved in these businesses for ten years and it earns her about 76,700KHR per day. 

Due to having not enough rain to do farming last year, her crops did not grow well and it affected her daily income. Now she lacks funds to do the farming, so she decided to take a loan via VisionFund to fulfill her needs. 

This is the second loan cycle for her group, which consist of three members. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farming. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farming

loans.name: Theam's Group

texts.en:
Theam is ages 49 years old and a mother of three children; two of them are dependent child, living in Pursat province. Nowadays, she struggles with her family’s hardship through growing cassava and working on other farms for fees. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 101,400KHR per day. 

Due to her cassava growing not well, her yields were decreased as well as her income. Now she has not enough funds to do the farming, so she decided to take a new loan via VisionFund for doing farming. 

This is the fourth loan cycle for her while the other two in her group are first and fourth loan cycle. She will take her loan portion to pay for labor fees. She hopes to improve her family’s living condition through this loan.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees to improve her farm's yield this year

loans.name: Manushaqe

texts.en:
Manushaqe works doing recycling. She sells recycled items in the little front yard of her so-called family house. Manushaqe and her family are very poor as you can see from this photograph where she appears with her two sons.

Manushaqe is requesting a loan to build a cabin to store her recycling items until she sells them. She and her family are seeking your compassion.

loans.use: to build a cabin to store her recycled items

loans.name: Gjelë

texts.en:
Gjele being photographed in front of a cabin she has to store things, is a villager in her fifties, with two children.  She does agriculture to earn an income for the family. 

She is requesting from you an amount of 200,000 Albanian Lek to buy a harvester for harvesting and this will be used by her husband. “I have my activity and I wanted my husband to had one too, so, I thought what would be better than this to keep him busy most of the time.
