He has been suffering with his lungs now for a long time and has been receiving disability income of $170/month, yet he can do this activity, so I chose for him very well, ” said Gjele laughing and teasing her husband, who did not want to be in the picture.

loans.use: to buy for her husband a motor harvester for reaping

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand its production and collection capabilities to continue to support the more than 1,500 small farmers in the Andes mountains

loans.name: Alison

texts.es:
Alison es una mujer de 32 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de licores.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, luchadora, responsable y m uy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el camino a ‘villa Adela’ área caracterizada por unir varias zonas a través de redes de transporte público, desde este lugar se puede conseguir transporte a zonas alejadas de la ciudad. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Alison es de piel morena, ojos pardos, cabello teñido color rojizo largo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de licores como; singani (a base de uva blanca), ron, wiski, cerveza, vodka, etc., actividad que realiza en su tienda ubicada en la parte baja de su casa, en horarios del día y fines de semana hasta la madrugada, “inicié mi negocio como ayudante en otra licorería, con la ayuda de mi ex pareja, logré acumular un capital con el que mantengo a mi hijo ahora…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los fines de semana cuenta con ventas constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer con mayor variedad y cantidad su negocio. Su sueño es ser distribuidora mayorista, ella desea realizar la compra de variedad de licores para abastecer su negocio y pagar los gastos de manutención de su hijo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Alison solicita un préstamo para la compra de licores para abastecer su tienda y pagar los gastos de alimentación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Alison, age 32, is single and has a 12 year old son.  Her business is selling liquor.  She is a good mother.  She is enterprising, independent, tenacious, responsible, and very hard-working.  She conducts her business on the road to Villa Adela.  It is an area known for uniting several areas through public transportation networks.  From this place you can get transportation to areas outside the city.  It has a cold and dry climate with temperatures that varies during the day between 0 to 12 degrees centigrade.

Alsion has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long hair that is dyed a reddish color.  She is short and has a strong build.  Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks where she lives.  She speaks Spanish with the general public and for her business.  She shares her life with her son, who goes to school.  She lives in a family house, which is built of brick and cement and has a corrugated tin roof and a wood floor.  She has running water, electricity, gas, and indoor plumbing.

Her business is selling liquors like ‘singani’ (made from white grapes), rum, whiskey, beer, and vodka, etc.  She conducts her business in her store, which is in the bottom part of her house.  Her schedule is during the day and on the week-ends until dawn.  “I started my business as a helper in another liquor business.  With the help of my ex-life partner, I managed to accumulate some capital with which I now support my son,” she says.

The advantage of her business is that on the week-ends she has steady sales.  The disadvantage is the lack of capital to stock a greater variety and quantity for her business.  Her dream is to be a wholesale distributor.  

She wishes to buy a variety of liquors to stock her business and to pay her son’s living expenses.  This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 15 years she has been engaged in this business activity.

That is why Alison is requesting a loan to buy liquors to stock her store and to pay the expenses of feeding her son.

loans.use: to buy liquors to stock her store and to pay the expenses of feeding her son.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 29 year old mother with 4 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Pauline requested for a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, printing machine, to assist her run the business. 

She has been doing this for more than 2 years. She hopes to expand her business using her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, printing machine,

loans.name: Selvistra

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Selvistra works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from seaweeds culture. Selvistra is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to  buy new fish nets, bamboo, rope, etc for her fishing business.

Selvistra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fish nets, bamboo, rope, etc for her fishing business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, three of whom in school. Flordeliza  works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell fish.  Flordeliza is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed, plastic rope, etc for her seaweed culture business.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweeds, plastic rope, etc

loans.name: Tolin

texts.en:
Tolin wants to invest on a dairy cow and your loan will help him achieve that. He is a married father of a 4-year-old daughter and has been photographed with her. He’s been doing livestock as a source of income for his family and currently he’s got two dairy cows and sells roughly 15 liters or raw milk a day to a nearby dairy farm and he also sells two baby calves a year. 

In the agricultural land he owns, he plants only food for the animals and in addition veggies and grains for family consumption and some ducks and chickens also. His elderly mother who lives with them, with a retirement pension of approximately $130/month so this is an income as well for the family.

loans.use: to expand the livestock by adding one more dairy cow, with your financial help

loans.name: Taulant

texts.en:
This is Taulant, a villager from southeastern rural Albania. He is 33 years old and the married father of two children ages six and 10. Taulant works with livestock and focuses on sheep. This is the only source of income for his family.  “I love animals and in particular, sheep. They are easier to manage, comparing to cows that are big in stature and goats that make you run out of breath all the time. Currently, I’ve got 40 sheep and want to add some more, 10 at the moment. From the ones I have I sell approximately 40 liters of raw milk a day to some nearby dairy farms who then make delicious cheese. The places I take my sheep to graze have good grass for them and it’s not polluted as well,” said Taulant laughing and directing his vision towards the sheep.

Taulant is requesting a loan to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep

loans.name: 05 - Tân Hà  - Đông Hương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thủy is 43 years old and she is married. Thủy lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village.
 
She has had a retail business for more than 10 years, selling dry food and general things such as cake, sweet, sugar, and milk.

The main hardship that Thủy faces is a lack of capital.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweet, sugar and milk to sell.

This is Thủy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her business to do well. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweet, sugar and milk to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 06 - Phố 6 - Quảng Thắng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hạnh is 37 years old and she is married. Hạnh lives in Thanh Hoa city, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover, this job is unstable. She has worked in agriculture farming food for more than 10 years.

She can't get loan from other banks or credit institutions because they think she is not able to repay.

The main hardship that Hạnh faces is a lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry and animal feed to raise chickens to sell in the future.

This is Hạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her business to do well.  She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry and animal feed to raise chickens and sell in the future

loans.name: Laveitiga

texts.en:
Laveitiga is a Samoan citizen, 57 year old  and a mother with 3 children.  She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. 

Laveitiga requested a loan to buy a freezer, box of twistiest, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, and plastic bags to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of twistiest, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish and plastic bags

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman, with 3 children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, shoes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals and describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes, shoes. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes, shoes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells soda, flour, sugar, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, soap, soda, bread and other items. Her business goal is to open more business outlets within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, soap, soda, bread and other items

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 52 years old and married with two children who are in school, Norma  works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Norma  has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Norma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to fully pay for his motorcycle and buy more second hand clothes to sell. He still owns a motorcycle that he uses for transporting people and that is where he earns a living. He also sells second hand clothes and shoes to earn extra income. 

He started this business to look after his family. He still faces challenges of inadequate capital to meet the high demand and the high rate of taxation, however his dream is to buy a motor vehicle and become a prominent businessman.

He is requesting for a loan to buy another used motorcycle to use for transportation.

loans.use: to buy another used motorcycle to use for transportation.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man with 5 children, of whom 4 attend school in Kasese Uganda. He owns a general store shop receiving additional income from a bar. He has been in business since 2003 and faced with a challenge of low capital. He started the business so as to develop himself. He describes himself as being hard working and shrewd. 

He is requesting a loan to buy materials like sand and bricks for constructing his residential house to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to buy materials like sand and bricks for constructing his residential house

loans.name: Nalton

texts.en:
Nalton just finished paying his previous loan. He is a plumber. Nalton says, “so far, the activity has been good but there are difficulties because I’ve been lacking a car. And I’ve got to pay to get to clients and I cannot offer services immediately due to this. Thus, a car would help my business immensely and I would very much appreciate lender help again.” He spoke with a branch assistant at VisionFund Albania while being interviewed.

Nalton is requesting a loan to buy a vehicle for his plumbing business so he can travel to his clients.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for his plumbing business

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Minh Hải Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Trang is 30 years old and she is married. Trang lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has had a manufacturing business sewing clothes for three years. The family is a low-income household in the village, moreover, this job is unstable.  

The main hardship that Trang faces is a lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more sewing machine and cloth to maintain her tailoring service.

In 2014, Trang joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Trang hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house. She also wants her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing machine and cloth to maintain her tailoring service.

loans.name: 02 - Bào Ngoại - Phường Đông Hương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Quynh is 46 years old and she is married. Quynh lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.  She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling snacks for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Quynh faces is a lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to maintain her store selling noodles for breakfast.

This is Quynh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Quynh hopes for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to maintain her store selling noodles for breakfast.

loans.name: 03 - Bào Ngoại - Phường Đông Hương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Sửu is 42 years old and she is married with a child. She has had a service business providing housing rentals for more than 10 years. Sửu lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province.

Her family is a low-income household in her village, moreover her current job is unstable. The main hardship that Sửu faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to maintain a childcare service.

This is Sửu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. As a result of her business profit, Sửu hopes for her family be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to maintain childcare service

loans.name: Gamil2 Group

texts.en:
Nimco is 40 years old and is married with five children who are all in school. She lives in Hargeisa City, Somaliland. For the past three years, Nimco has been working hard to manage her clothing and electronic supermarket where she sells clothes and electronics in Hargeisa. She is the one on the left side of this group photo and is the leader of a group known as Gamil2. The group consists of six members, three female and three male members, all of whom are co-owners of a supermarket. Gamil2 has repaid a prior Kiva loan. 

Gamil2 is requesting a 4,000 USD loan. Nimco will use her portion of the group loan to buy more electronics. Although each member will take a separate loan, all of the money will be invested their co-owned business. Nimco plans to generate greater profits and increase her working capital. Group members hope that, in the future, they will be able to open up another branch of their supermarket or enlarge this existing one.

loans.use: to buy electronics

loans.name: Sabri

texts.en:
Sabri wants to dig a well. He is in his late thirties and is a married father of two, 9 and 6 and they live in the rural central part of Albania. He worked in Greece for some years, but due to the economical conditions he came back to his home country, starting up an arboriculture type of activity. He planted mostly apple orchards, along with peaches and he is selling fruit to wholesale buyers.
 
“The activity has been going well and keeps me busy because it requires so much hard labour and makes me hopeful as well that it will provide my family with an income. Besides this, my wife just started from home repairing and stitching clothes and most of the months she makes about $200/month,” said Sabri to the branch assistant, during the disbursement process.

loans.use: to dig a well for watering his apple and peach orchards

loans.name: Nhóm 05 - Phố 6 - Quảng Thắng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nhuần is 62 years old and she is married, but her husband is too old and weak and he can't help her to make income. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Nhuần has worked in agriculture, farming food for more than 10 years. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this job is unstable. 

The main hardship that Nhuần faces is a lack of capital. Before she joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, she had no money to buy poultry to raise and improve her income. 

In 2014, Nhuần joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. 

She is requesting a new loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Nhuần is a reputable person in the community; she is the leader of a solidarity borrowers group with seven members.

With her business profit, Nhuần hopes for her business to do well.  She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 04 - Phố 6 - Quảng Thắng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Vĩnh is 49 years old and she is married.  She has had a retail business selling dry food and general thing for more than 10 years.  Vĩnh lives in Thanh Hoa city, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable . 
The main hardship that Vĩnh faces is lack of capital.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweet, suger, milk,... to resell.  In 2014, Vĩnh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Vĩnh has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Vĩnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweet, sugar, milk to resell

loans.name: Doriana

texts.en:
For about two years now Doriana has been operating a grocery store in a town in southeastern Albania. She now is seeking your financial help to buy inventory for this store. Neither Doriana nor her husband has another profitable activity, thus, she is almost begging for your help. She is 33 and a mother of two children, 8 and 6 and they are struggled financially to make ends meet.

“Living in a town has its own good and bad points, including the disadvantage of not having other opportunities to earn an income, such as rural activities. That makes it really hard for us and some of our customers as well who buy on credit and who sometimes have no money at all to pay for what they owe us,” said Doriana, to the branch assistant during the interview.

loans.use: to operate a grocery store and she wants the loan to stock up on inventory items

loans.name: 01 - Quang Trung - Phường Đông Hương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hà is 38 years old and she is married with 2 children. Her husband had a stroke so he can not help her. Hà has to work so hard to make money for all expenses of whole family and let her children go to school.
 
She has had a retail business selling cake, sweet, suger, milk,... and general thing for more than 10 years.Hà lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.  Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Hà faces is lack of capital.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweet, suger, milk,... to resell and also repair her store.
This is Hà's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweet, sugar, milk,... to resell and also repair her store

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Minh Hùng Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phương is 31 years old and she is married.   She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling snacks for 3 years.
Phương lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable . 
The main hardship that Phương faces is lack of capital.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to maintain her store selling noodles for breakfast.
In 2013, Phương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Phương has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to maintain her stall selling noodles for breakfast.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married woman with two children ages 10 and 17. She is a resident of the town of Talibon, Bohol. For the past nine years, Marcelina has owned and operated a hollow-block manufacturing business. She needs additional capital to support her business.

Marcelina is requesting a loan to purchase cement, sand, and gravel, and to pay for maintenance for the transportation vehicles. Her loan is necessary for her to produce blocks and to help maintain the safety of her truck when delivering orders. Marcelina will use the profit from her loan to repay her obligations and start to expand her business. In the future, she dreams of building her own home and being able to continue to support the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and gravel and to pay to maintain her business vehicle

loans.name: 130001.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hồng is 35 years old and she is married  She has had a retail business selling toilet paper and general items for 5 years.
Hồng lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Hồng faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase toilet paper to resell.
This is Hồng first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase toilet paper and other general items to resell

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 36 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Carol is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Carol has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from tricycle passengers.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gjirak

texts.en:
Gjirak is a villager who wants your financial help of 200,000 Albanian Lek to buy fertilizers and pay for workers who will help him with the agro work. 

He is 55 years old and a married father of a 22-year-old. He’s been doing agriculture for all these past 25 years and has been the only source of income for his family, with him being the only one to do labour work since his wife cannot do hard work due to a medical condition. 

He plants mainly red and green bell peppers and also potatoes and he sells them all.  In addition to this, he plants wheat but he keeps it all for the family for the bread and other flour needs.  When he harvests the wheat, he then goes to some primitive mills where he pays for the grinding.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay some workers to help him out with some hard agricultural demands

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widow woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 51 years old and has two children who are in school.

Elizabeth has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 58 years old and she is married, with five children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Marivic has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Marivic aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Alita works hard to support her family. She has a purified water retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen food. 

Alita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy an additional stock of purified water to sell to customers.

Alita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of purified water to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and she is married, with four children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Erlinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 56 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Salvacion is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Salvacion has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: 04 - Tân Hà - Phường Đông Hương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Yến is 43 years old, and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years. She is the breadwinner of the family with three dependents.

Yến lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover her job is unstable. The main hardship that Yến faces is lack of capital. With the loan, she intends to purchase more fish to expand her business.

This is Yến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Yến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to have enough money to let her children go to school, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Minh Thọ Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hương operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Hương is 28 years old, and she is married with no children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 06 Minh Thọ Minh Lộc Solidarity Group. 

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Hương has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to buy a motorbike, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children. All of her children are in school.

She runs a rice retailing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a food vending business.

Riza dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She has a personal care product retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more personal care products to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fish vending.

Madeline dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Mighty Grace

texts.en:
Mighty Grace is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mighty Grace is 24 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mighty Grace has a food market business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

Mighty Grace has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Elsa is 47 years old and has one child who is in school.

Elsa has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Elsa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Salif, c’est l’homme qui tient la corne du Bœuf sur la photo. Âgé de 46 ans, il est Marié, sa femme est une ménagère. Salif  n’a pas été à  l’école, c’est un client RMCR et il est emboucher ovin. Il est père de 11 enfants dont  quatre (04) garçons sont scolarisés.
Il fait cette activité d’embouche bovine depuis plus d’une décennie, et il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Après ses ventes son bénéfice peut varier entre 20 000 f à 30 000 f CFA. Avec ses profits il parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille : tel que  la couverture sanitaire, habillements, la scolarisation de ses enfants et alimentaires
Salif  souhaite dans l’avenir avoir plus de fonds afin de pouvoir faire face au bien naître de ses enfants.
texts.en: Salif is the man who is holding on to the bull's horn in the photo. He is 46 years old and married, and his wife is a housewife. Salif did not go to school. He is a customer of RMCF and raises bulls. He is father to 11 children, of whom four boys go to school. He has been raising bulls for more than ten years and gets his supplies in the surrounding markets. On selling his animals his profit can vary between 20,000 to 30,000 francs. With his profits he manages to provide for his family's needs, for example his children's healthcare, their clothing and schooling. Salif would like to have more money in the future so he can continue to provide for his children's well-being.

loans.use: to buy bulls to sell on.

loans.name: Muhumed

texts.en:
Muhumed is a 42-year-old man and he lives in Hargiesa, Somaliland. He is the father of 8 children, three girls and five boys and all of them go to school. 

Muhumed buys sheep and goat skins from the local butcher market, which he then resells to the animal hides and skin industry in Dacar Budhuq village which is located in the east of Hargiesa . He has been running his business for the last 12 years.

He requested a loan of $1500  from Kaaba Micro-finance Institution. The loan will be used to buy more sheep and goat skins and this will help Muhumed to generate greater profits and increase his working capital

loans.use: To purchase more sheep and goat skins.

loans.name: Trabajando Juntas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres (CAROLINA DEL CARMEN, MARCELINA DORIS y MINORI) de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios; se organizaron hace 2 años para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

MINORI: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer alegre de 27 años de edad, casada con 4 hijos menores de edad. Su esposo trabaja como acopiador de mariscos. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 1 año se dedica a la venta de ropa usada de manera ambulante. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca de ropa mixta y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi y así incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de su familia. Ella sueña en diversificar sus productos y comercializar mariscos y pescados.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is composed of three women (Carolina del Carmen, Marcelina Doris, and Minori) whose ethnicity is Miskita from the city of Bilwi in Puerto Cabezas municipality. They are enterprising women who struggle daily to make their small businesses grow. Two years ago, the group organized to gain access to loans with the solid backing of Pana Pana.

Minori is a member of this solidarity group. She is a happy woman, 27 years of age, married with four children, all minors. Her husband works as a shellfish gatherer. With the proposition of counting on her own source of income and contributing to cover household expenses, Minori began selling used clothing on the streets roughly a year ago.

She is requesting financing to purchase a pack of mixed clothing in Managua to sell at accessible prices to her customers in Bilwi and, thus, increase family income and improve, little by little, her family's conditions of life. 

Minori dreams of diversifying her products and of being able to sell shellfish and fish.

loans.use: buy a pack of mixed clothing in Managua, the capital,to sell in Bilwi.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta is a 27 year old mother with 2 children. She runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year to earn a living. 

Ruta requested for a loan to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves, backpack sprayer, chemicals, to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves, backpack sprayer, chemicals,

loans.name: 02 - Tân Hà - Phường Đông Hương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga is 38 years old, and she is married with two children. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fruit for more than 10 years.

Nga lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family lives in a low-income household in her village, moreover her husband is a mason, and both of their jobs are unstable.

The main hardship that Nga faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to resell. This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 37 years old with 2 children. She operates a business of bingo(game) in her village to earn a living. 

Rachael request for a loan to buy a bingo machine, paper bingo, ink bottle to use run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a bingo machine, paper bingo, ink bottle

loans.name: Janulla

texts.en:
The reason why she is seeking your financial help again is to pay for her son's university tuition fees. 

And she also wants to thank you very much for your understanding.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees; he has been accepted into the master's program

loans.name: Bajame

texts.en: Bajame wanted to invest in a pump sprayer this time; the one she had broke. She plants a lot, thus such a tool will make her work easier. This year she planted potatoes, wheat and beans, like almost every year.

loans.use: To purchase a pump sprayer

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a 45-years-old man and he lives in Hargiesa, Somaliland. He is a responsible father of 9 children.  He owns a small shop in the State House market which he has been running for the last 6 years. He sells vegetables, rice sugar etc. 

Ahmed wants to expand his small shop by buying more rice and sugar so he requested a loan of $600 from Kaaba MFI. In future he wants to open another shop in State House where internally displaced people live.

loans.use: To expand his small vegetables and rice shop

loans.name: Nhóm 04 - Phố 5 - Quảng Thắng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Vinh is 61 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture farming food for more than 10 years.

Vinh lives in Thanh Hoa City, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in her village, moreover her job is unstable. The main hardship that Vinh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Vinh joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Vinh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. After two loans, she bought some new furniture for her family with some of her additional profit.

Vinh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good jobs in future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 64 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her dried fish business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Marjana

texts.en:
Marjana has started doing recycling of scrap plastic for a living and with the loan that she is seeking she wants to invest in this activity'  Also to make available some cabin where she can store the plastics until she sells them. 

She is in the photographed with her son who is under the age of 18 but they do the recycling together.

loans.use: to invest in a plastics recycling business

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoc is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and two children. Husbandry and a small business are main income sources of her family. She can cover the family’s daily costs and education from selling chicken, duck, pig and vegetables from her garden. 

With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Mrs. Diep is 34 years old. She is married and has two children, so she works very hard to provide for them. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and small business.

She is interested in improving the living standards for her family, so she really needs this loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Mrs. Linh is a hard working woman who is 55 years old. She lives with three children, and all of them have a job. 

She would like to borrow this loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living conditions and health of her family. Her income is mainly from husbandry, cultivation, and small business, so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Mrs. Men is 30 years old, married, and has a baby. She works hard to support her family. 

She would like to improve her family’s living standards - especially for her child - but she lacks capital. This loan can help her build a sanitary latrine. She is able to repay the loan from her salary selling vegetables and chicken.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Mrs. Linh is a hardworking woman who is 27 years old. She is married and has a baby. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family's living standard. 

Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyet is 51 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in a rural area and raising poultry and cattle are her main jobs, which she has been doing for more than 20 years. With this work she is able to pay the loan monthly. 

This loan will help her to build a sanitary latrine in order to improve her living standards, especially for her children.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Hazel Vanessa

texts.es: Hazel tiene la edad de 19 años, está casada y no tienen hijo actualmente. Ella con el crédito va comprar uno novillas de doble propósito. Ella cuenta con los potreros actos para la explotación de este proyecto, ella cuenta con buenos repastos por lo cual quiere comprar unos animales más. Ella espera con este sacarle el máximo de provecho a sus pastos y así poder generar más ingresos para el bienestar de su núcleo familiar y a la vez poder ir saliendo con los pagos del crédito. Ella es la primera vez que solicita el crédito en FUDECOSUR y nunca antes había trabajado en otros Bancos Estatales.
texts.en:
Hazel is 19-years old.  She is married and doesn't currently have any children.
With the loan, Hazel plans purchase heifers for two purposes.  She has pastureland ready to use for this project.  She has some good cattle and wants to purchase a few more animals.  She hopes to take full advantage of her pastures and be able to generate more income for the benefit of her nuclear family.  She also wants to get ahead with her loan repayment.
This is the first time Hazel has requested a loan from FUDECOSUR.  She has not worked with State Banks in the past.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for her farm.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 - Phố 5 - Quảng Thắng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thường is 52 years old and married. She has worked in agriculture farming food for more than 10 years.

Thường lives in Thanh Hoa City, in a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover her job is unstable. 

The main hardship that Thường faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Thường joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Thường has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She also bought more chickens and repaired the coops.

With her business profit, Thường hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 01 - Phố 6 - Quảng Thắng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hồng is 39 years old, and she is married with four children. Her husband has one amputated leg. She has worked in agriculture farming food for more than 10 years.

Hồng lives in Thanh Hoa City, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her household was recognized by the local government as poor, moreover her job is unstable. The main hardship that Hồng faces is lack of capital. Before she joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, her income was just from a small field.

In 2014, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Hồng has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She has capital to raise chickens and pigs now. She is requesting a new loan to maintain her livestock business.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs and chickens to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
For most of his life, Benard has been employed in the government as a civil servant. Currently at 66 years, he is retired and involved in several business including a carpentry workshop and real estate. As he says, his core goal now is to give back to his society by creating job opportunities for youths in his community. So far, he has been able to create six job opportunities through his business ventures.

Benard has lived in Nairobi’s Kiambiu area for five years and is a witness to poor and lack of sanitation facilities. At the entertainment joint he owns for instance exists a poorly maintained urinal that exhibits an awful stench chasing away his customers. In addition, entrepreneurs and residents in that area cannot easily access toilets hence numerous flying toilets are openly disposed.

His friend Boniface runs two Fresh Life Toilets and was the one who introduced him to this toilet option. Benard whose next project was the establishment of commercial toilet facilities was thrilled that he had found a solution to his predicament. He now wants to establish two Fresh Life Toilets, one to serve customers and staff at his joint while the other targets residents and entrepreneurs of Kiambiu area.

Benard is optimistic that with the establishment of toilet facilities for his community, he will contribute towards cleaning his immediate environment from flying toilets and will further create the much needed employment opportunity for more young people. He hopes to hire an attendant who will ensure compliance and good maintenance of the Fresh Life Toilets.

Let us join in and help Benard in providing hygienic and accessible toilet facilities to his community!

loans.use: To pay for two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Mrs. Tam is a hardworking woman who is 29 years old. There are five people in her family. She would like to improve her living standards. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine.

She is able to repay the loan from selling chickens, ducks, pigs and vegetables.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Mrs. Anh is 41 years old, married and has two children, all of them are schooling. She works very hard to feed &educate her children.

 She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine and she is able to repay the loan from husbandry and salary.

loans.use: To build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Mrs. Suong is a hardworking woman who is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house without a hygienic latrine. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family's living standards. 

Her family’s income is mainly from a small business and husbandry, so she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Luan

texts.en:
Mrs. Luan is 42 years old, married and has two children. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improving the health of her family, as well as environmental protection. 

Husbandry and a small business are the main income sources of her family, and she is able to pay the loan monthly from a chicken-raising activity.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Mojahed

texts.en:
Mojahed is a 21-year-old single man from Tulkarm City. Mojahed own a small farm and he takes care of it very well. He has a passion for agriculture which is both his hobby and his only source of income. 

He took a USD loan from FATEN to buy seedlings and fertilizer.  For his farm. Mojahed is dreaming to buy other agricultural land in the future. Mojahed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his business and fix the barn.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 48-year-old married woman from Qalqilia City. She is a mother of two sons and three daughters. Asmaa has a store for women's clothes. She is a successful business woman who is managing her own business very well.

Asmaa requested a loan from FATEN, which she will use to buy the summer collection for her clothing store. With the loan, Asmaa will be able to increase her sales and her income.

loans.use: to purchase the summer collection for her clothing store.

loans.name: Nhóm 07 - Phố 5 - Quảng Thắng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thúy is 49 years old and married. She has worked in agriculture farming food for more than 10 years.

Thúy lives in Thanh Hoa City, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover her job is unstable. The main hardship that Thúy faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

In 2014, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Abunda

texts.en:
Abunda is 51 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who are in school.

Abunda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Abunda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Abunda has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Abunda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en:
Maricor is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a purified water retail in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of purified water to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Maricor dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home

loans.use: to buy more stocks of purified water to sell.

loans.name: Orrego Herrera Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Lina es una joven de 22 años de edad, ella es madre cabeza de familia y tiene una pequeña de 3, trabaja en la venta de mercancía una actividad que le permite generar recursos y criar a su hija.

Esta joven se encuentra solicitando un préstamo, el motivo de este es que se cansó de solo producir lo suficiente para vivir, solo paga las deudas y comida y ella quiere tener algo más, desea brindarle a su hijo un futuro prometedor, tener un local propio, tiene ambición quiere estudiar quiere progresar y ser alguien en la vida.

Lina quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de ropa, lociones, pijamas, accesorios para hombre, tendrá mercancía y capital de trabajo para negociar con sus clientes y ofrecerles comodidades de pagos.
texts.en:
Lina, 22, has a 3-year old daughter and is the head of her small family.  She operates a clothing sales business and earns just enough to pay her bills.  

Lina came to us because she is fed up with barely getting by, only putting food on the table and paying off debt.  She wants more for herself and her little girl.  She wants to open a store of her own and continue her studies.  In short, she wants to make something of her life.  

Lina is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with clothing, lotions, pajamas, and other merchandise that she will resell.  The investment will allow her to offer better payment terms to her customers.

loans.use: to stock her retail sales business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute. This is her story.

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy most?
Anna: I am studying for a Bachelor of Business Arts degree at Maharishi Institute. I enjoy Transcendental Meditation, which has to do with my inner self and consciousness. Business courses that I like are Human Resources Management and Financial Management. They are the courses that I enjoy the most.

What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: In which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
Anna: My goal is to become a successful business woman, as I will have the qualifications that will help me to start my own business or to work in a business company. I would like to work in a top management department in the business sector. Durban, Johannesburg, and Cape Town are all cities I would like to work in and travel to.

Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
Anna: I was born and raised in Maseru, Lesotho by two married parents. I have two siblings (two sisters) and no children. I am planning to have children when I am done at Maharishi Institute, financially stable, and married. My father was working in the mines before he passed away in 2003. As for my mother, she has never worked or had a stable job; she only had piece jobs here and there.

What do you like to do in your spare time?
Anna: I like learning new things, reading motivational books, and spending my spare time hanging out with friends and family.

How will Kiva change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
Anna: A Kiva loan will change my life for the better, as I will not struggle with expenses for transportation to school. I will concentrate more in my studies, knowing that I get help somewhere. That will also help me a lot with my rent.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Intitute.

loans.name: Murat

texts.en: Murat wants to start a small car washing machine activity. For this, he needs your help with a loan in an amount of 140,000 ALL.

loans.use: to start a car washing service activity

loans.name: Dolca Isabel

texts.es: Dolca inició su vida laboral como docente de preescolar sin embargo su salario difería de sus necesidades; lo que ganaba en dos días era equivalente a un día salarial como estilista en un Salón de Belleza, razón por la que decidió capacitarse por intermedio de una institución del estado en este oficio.  Realizó prácticas en un Salón de Belleza y La propietaria que era estilista profesional le enseñó técnicas para dar mejores acabados a sus servicios.  Hace 13 años aperturó su Salón de Belleza que funciona desde el garaje de su vivienda ubicada en un barrio del municipio de Soledad, ofreciendo servicios de excelente calidad; blower, cortes de cabello, tinturaciones, pedicure, manicures y tratamientos capilares, a los residentes del sector así mismo les ofrece productos de belleza que exhibe en vitrina desde su negocio.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para adecuar su salón con una nueva silla de  peluquería, una mesa para pedicure y surtir con productos de belleza como keratinas, shampoo, masajes capilares, esmaltes y demás.  Dolca es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad y su meta es continuar ayudando económicamente en los estudios universitarios de su hijo.
texts.en:
Dolca started her working life as a pre-school teacher but her salary was not sufficient for her needs. What she made in two days was equivalent to one day's work as a stylist in a Beauty salon. For that reason she decided to study at the State institute for this trade. She did her practicum in a Beauty salon and the owner who was a professional stylist taught her techniques to get better end results.

Thirteen years ago she opened her own Beauty salon which is located in the garage of her house in a neighborhood in the municipality of Soledad. She offers high quality services, styling, hair cuts, dying, manicures and hair treatments to the residents of her area. She also offers them beauty products that she has in her display case in her business.

She is currently requesting her first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to adapt her salon with a new hair cutting chair, a pedicure table and stock beauty products like keratin, shampoo, hair massage, nail polish and others.

Dolca is the mother of two grown-up children and her goal is to continue to help economically with her son's university studies.

loans.use: to adapt her salon with a new hair cutting chair, a pedicure table and stock beauty products like keratin, shampoo, hair massage, nail polish and others.

loans.name: Yakeline Patricia

texts.es:
La historia de Yakeline es muy bella, ella junto con su hermano tiene un negocio de producción de calzado el cual iniciaron por casualidad, pues se encontraban sin empleo, hablaron de sus cualidades y que podían hacer y nació la idea de producir calzado, iniciaron con unas muestras y las llevaron a mostrar en los almacenes gustaron mucho y ahora tiene encargos.
Ellos hacen los calzados artesanalmente y fabrican pocas unidades debido a la falta de capital para comprar insumos y maquinaria que optimicen sus tiempos de producción,
Ahora con una idea de negocio firme, con clientes y pedidos Yakeline quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una máquina plana para confeccionar cuero y compra de insumos (cuero) para mejorar en todos los aspectos el tiempo de producción del calzado.
texts.en:
Yakeline’s story is very beautiful. She operates a shoe store together with her brother, which they began by chance. 

As they were unemployed, they began talking about their skill sets and what they could do, and thus the idea to produce footwear was born. They started with some samples, which the stores they showed them to liked and now they have purchase orders. 

They made shoes by hand, and due to lack of capital to buy materials and machinery to optimize their production they make few units. 

Now that they have a firm business plan with clients and purchase orders Yakeline would like a loan to buy a flat machine to cure leather, as well as purchase materials (leather) to improve all aspects of the shoe production time.

loans.use: to buy a machine to cure leather and purchase materials (leather) to improve all aspects of the shoe production time.

loans.name: Borama Group

texts.en:
Hasan is 30 year old and he lives in Borama town. He has 4 children. Hasan is contractor who builds houses for the public. 

He needs building materials such as skeleton constructions in order to build more houses and get more income when he has his required goods. 

He is the leader of group known as Borama Group, which consists of 11 members, 9 males and 2 females. All of the group members have an existing different businesses and they need to expand their medium and small businesses. 

Hasan requested a loan of $1500 from Kaaba Micro finance Institution to purchase building materials.

loans.use: To purchase building materials for house construction

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar panel system.

loans.name: Jose Abder

texts.es:
José Abder tiene 27 años de edad, conviviente sin hijos, vive con su cónyugue en el caserio cabramayo- Distrito de Colasay , que pertenece a la provincia de Jaén, Región Cajamarca, Sierra Norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza es la agricultura principalmente cultivo de arroz, en terreno propio ubicado en la misma zona en la que vive. Tiene más de 05años de experiencia en el rubro de la agricultura, ademas de ello José cuenta con una parada de yunta con la cual realiza labores agrícolas en su caserío y caserío cercanos percibiendo otros ingresos,goza de muy buenas referencias personales,el préstamo lo utilizará en los gastos de sembrado y mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz de variedad linea idal ( capital de trabajo), esto le generará cubrir en mayor volumen la demanda de su producto, y por lo mismo tendrá mayores ingresos permitiendo de esta forma que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Abder is 27-years old. He is married and does not have children. He lives with his wife in the Cabramayo village, Colasay District, which is a part of Jaén Province and Cajamarca Region on Perú's northern coast.

José's business is agriculture, primarily growing rice on his own land, which is located in the same area where he lives. José has more than five years of experience in the field of agriculture. In addition, José has a team of livestock which he uses for agricultural work in his own village and in nearby villages, which provides him another income.

José enjoys very good personal references. He will use the loan to help with the expense of planting and maintaining his rice crop, which is of the "idal" variety; he will use it for working capital. This will help him generate of greater volume of crop to meet the demand for his product. It will also give him a greater income, which will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: with the expenses of planting and maintaining his rice crop.

loans.name: Analen

texts.en:
Analen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Analen dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maechelle

texts.en:
Maechelle is 31 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Maechelle is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maechelle requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maechelle has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maechelle would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Luz Estella

texts.es:
Ella es Luz es una mujer de 68 años de edad que junto con su marido trabajan en un negocio de cría y engorde de ganado porcino, es la actividad que les ha dado de comer durante gran parte de su vida y que espera que los sotenga en la vejez.
Luz no tiene hijos ni familiares su negocio es lo único que lso mantendrá en su vejez por ello lo cuidan y a pesar de su avanzada edad lo trabajan 7 horas diarias.

Luz quiere solicitar un préstamo para mejorar sus ventas, darle sostenibilidad al negocio, incrementar su utilidad y dicho monto de dinero lo invertirá de la siguiente manera, compra cerdos y el cuido para tener un abastecimiento de 6 meses de alimento.
texts.en:
Luz, 68, and her husband operate a business raising and selling pigs.  They have operated the business for much of their lives together and say that it has put food on their table all these years and that it will continue to support them in their old age.  Luz has no children or other relatives so the business will be her only source of income in the years ahead.  Consequently, she is careful to maintain the business, working 7 hours a day despite her 68 years.

Luz is applying for a loan because she wants to maintain and grow her business.  She will use the loan to buy more pigs and stock a 6-month supply of feed for them.

loans.use: to pay for more animals and animal feed for her pig sales business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 52 years old and has one child who is in school.

Erlinda has a food market business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

Erlinda has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 43 years and she supports four children.She has been selling bags and clothes in the market for the last 17 years and the business earns she KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more stocks of bags for sale to clients to meet both client and family needs.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children.Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business sector.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bags for sale to clients to meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Jana

texts.en:
Jana is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jana is 43 years old and has one child who is in school.

Jana has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jana requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jana has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Jana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Olive dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marlen Trinidad

texts.es:
Ella es una madre de 30 años de edad llamada Marlen, la cual tiene dos hijos de 7 y 14 años de edad, trabaja vendiendo ropa por catálogo, una actividad que inicio por necesidad económica buscando suplir las falencias económicas que se presentan en su hogar.

Marlen tiene un sueño comprar una vivienda y ahora está emprendiendo un viaje que tiene como destino su hogar propio y quiere que la acompañes en este largo recorrido y puedes iniciar con un apoyo que le permitirá comprar surtido de ropa para mujer como jeans, blusas, camisas, entre otros.

Quiere comprar una vivienda para dejar como herencia a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marlen, 30, has two children, 14- and 7-years old, respectively.  She operates a business buying clothing from catalogs and reselling what she buys to her customers.  She started the business because she needed a way to earn enough money to pay her bills.

Marlen dreams of owning her own house and is starting a journey that she hopes will lead to a house of her own.  She wants you to join her on her journey and asks that you start by supporting her loan application.  She will use the loan to stock her business with women's clothing: jeans, blouses, shirts and other clothing pieces.  

Marlen hopes to make enough over time to buy a house, one that she can eventually leave to her children.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Jade

texts.en:
Jade is 43 years old and married with one child in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jade has a general store business in the Philippines. Jade requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jade has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jade would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman was born in 1981. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her husband who is working in the army with a low income. Iman is helping her husband financially by running her business of selling household supplies.

She started with a small quantity of products, and now she needs to expand her business by purchasing a larger quantity of household supplies and new products to increase her income. She has therefore applied for a loan to help her buy what she needs - supplies and products to sell - to expand her business and develop it.

loans.use: to help her buy supplies and products to sell to expand her business and develop it.

loans.name: Lefter

texts.en:
Lefter is pictured in the village bar-café that he has been operating it for five years. He wants to make some changes by buying new chairs and tables due to the fact that the existing ones are really damaged, along with renovations to the washroom that is in terrible condition at the moment.  

He is 49 years old and married and has three children: 22, 18 and 14. The youngsters go to relevant schools and the oldest, their daughter, works in a clothing factory for $200 a month. 

From the bar café they make about the same - $220/month - and they live in a village. “Living in a village is tough because you’ve got no jobs, but there are rural activities. The same goes on in the cities, because there are no jobs out there no matter how desperately you need the money. Life is the same in Albania for the majority of the population whether you live in the village or in the city,” said Lefter to the loan officer during the interview.

loans.use: to buy new chairs and tables and also renovate the washroom of the bar cafe

loans.name: Fahmy

texts.en: Fahmy is 27 years old, married, and has one little daughter. After his father's death, he became financially responsible for his mother and sister. Fahmy has a small grocery store which is the only source for income for his family. He is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy a refrigerator, some fizzy drinks and ice-creams to increase his income for his family and help his sister with her marriage expenses.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, some fizzy drinks and ice-creams

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima thought about a way to save herself and her children and provide a living for them. She started looking for a job, but she did not find one because of her inability to leave her children alone. 

She started working in selling cosmetics, accessories, and gifts to earn a simple income to cover some of her needs, and pay her house's rent. After she saved a good amount of money she opened her independent small shop beside her home. 

She wants to protect her family from hunger so she has asked for a loan to buy more kinds of products to sell; perhaps this will be enough to raise the level of her income and improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of products to sell

loans.name: Monwa

texts.en:
Monwa is a 33-years-old married woman from Ramallah city. She lives with her husband and one small son in a small house. Her husband was in prison for so long. 

Monwa works as an employee in a local company where she gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family.
Monwa would like to open her own business which is a small resturant. This is one of her dreams.

Monwa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to take a professional cooking training.  By taking this loan, Monwa will be able to start her new business and improve her family living conditions. 
Monwa appears in the photo

loans.use: to take a professional cooking training to be able to open a restaurant

loans.name: Nhóm 05 - Chợ - Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tuyết is 37 years old and she is married with 2 children.
 
She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling meat for more than 10 years. Tuyết lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. .

The main hardship that Tuyết faces is lack of capital. When she had not joined Thanh Hoa microfinance, her family was very poor. She lived with her old mother in law who use to be ill.  In 2011, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With the first loan, she began buying beef to resell for more income. 
 
Tuyết has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Her life is better now. She is requesting a new loan to purchase more beef for sale.
With her business profit, Tuyết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase beef for sale

loans.name: Nhóm 02 - Phố 6 - Quảng Thắng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên is 40 years old and married. Liên has worked in agriculture farming food for more than 10 years.

She lives in Thanh Hoa City, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover her job is unstable. She can't get loans from other banks or credit institutions, because they think she is not able to repay.

In 2014, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. The main hardship that Liên faces is lack of capital. She is requesting this loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 44 years old and is the mother of two children. She runs a sari-sari store business to help her husband pay their living expenses.

She always wanted to give a better life to her children, so she decided to borrow a loan to buy more items to sell. Being able to increase her store inventory, she will generate greater income.

Fe wants, for the future, to save money out from her business income.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Nhóm 03 - Phố 6 -  Quảng Thắng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vinh is 52 years old and married. She has worked in agriculture farming food for more than 10 years.

Vinh lives in Thanh Hoa City, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover her job is unstable. The main hardship that Vinh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Vinh joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Vinh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. With more profit, she repaired the chicken coop, therefore her chickens avoid epidemics.
