With her business profit, Vinh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 04 - Chợ - Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Linh is 33 years old and she is married.  She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for 5 years.
Linh lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Linh faces is lack of capital.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more general items like cake, sweet, sugar, milk,... to resell.
In 2014, Linh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. 

Linh has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Linh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more general food and non-food items like milk and cake for her store

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es: Marvin tiene la edad de 53 años, está casado, y actualmente vive solo con su esposa. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal como los son los abonos, plaguicidas y herbicidas. Él cuenta con terreno actos para la explotación de este cultivo, actualmente cuenta con mucho terreno sembrado y necesita asistir una parte nueva y no contaba con el dinero. El ya hace muchos años que se dedica a este proyecto por lo cual esta invirtiendo en su asistencia. El espera con esta mejora darle a sus plantaciones nuevas una mejor posibilidad de cosecha y obtener más producción que años anteriores y mejorar su estabilidad económica para tiempos futuros. Es el primer préstamo que recibe de FUDECOSUR. Él no había trabajado antes con otros Bancos Estatales.
texts.en: Marvin, 53, is married and he and his wife are on their own now.  Marvin is applying for a loan that he will use to buy supplies for his coffee growing business: fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, etc.  He has land for growing coffee, only some of which is planted.  He doesn't have enough money of his own to plant the rest of his land and will use the loan to do it.  Marvin has grown coffee for many years.  He expects this investment to give his new plants the best possible chance to grow so that he can maximize his yields and earn more from his next crop than he has from past ones.  A better yield will, he says, deliver a more stable financial future.  This is his first FUDECOSUR loan and he has never before worked with other state-owned banks.

loans.use: to support his coffee growing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric, buttons, thread, and accessories.

loans.name: Wayna Taucaray I Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WAYNA TAUCARAY I”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Giselda ella es soltera y tiene 32 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de restaurant, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the WAYNA TAUCARAY I community bank in Cusco, a district in the province of the same name.

Sra. Giselda, 32, is one of the group's members.  She is single and operates a grocery and restaurant business.  She sells everyday products such as rice, sugar, milk and snacks.  The business is, she says, her means of supporting herself.  Sra. Giselda is enterprising and hard-working.  She wants to grow her grocery business and is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with the products that she sells.

Sra. Giselda is grateful for this means of borrowing the funds she needs and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

The other members of the group have their own businesses: restaurants, clothing sales, corner groceries, and animal sales.

The members in the smaller photos at the bottom left of the larger photo had to work on the day the group picture was taken and asked to be photographed separately.

loans.use: to stock her grocery business.

loans.name: Elvis Gunnar

texts.es:
Elvis tiene 56 años de edad, conviviente, sin hijos, vive con su familia en este mismo distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, Costa norte de Perú.

Elvis se dedica a brindar servicios de sastrería y renovación de calzado, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, con muy buenas referencias laborales y personales, su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo compra de materiales como tela, hilos,cuero,entre otros, dicha inversión le servirá para realizar trabajos que clientes le solicitan, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona, lo que le generará mayores ingresos y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elvis is 56 years old, living with a partner and has no children. He and his family live in the Oyotún District, in a rural area of the Chiclayo Province, part of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Elvis provides tailoring and shoe repair services for a living. He has is own tools, more than ten years of experience in the business and very good professional and personal references to count on. His business is located within his home. Elvis is requesting this loan for the purchase of working capital: materials such as fabric, thread, leather and others.

The aforementioned loan will be of use to him in carrying out the work requested by his clients, having a great effect on the business. He hopes to improve the productivity of his service to be able to attend to the diverse needs of local customers. This will result in a greater income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy work materials, such as fabric, thread, leather and others.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a fruit vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like general store and fattening pigs businesses. 

Elsa dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 33 years old, married and has one child. 

Analyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Analyn has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evangeline is 35 years old and all of her children are attend in school.

Evangeline has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 40,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

Evangeline has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ulfiana

texts.en:
Ulfiana is 43 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ulfiana is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ulfiana has been farming vegetables for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Beviminda

texts.en:
Beviminda is 44 years old, married with two children.

Beviminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Beviminda has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Beviminda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 59 years old, married with six children. 

Aurelia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Aurelia requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Aurelia has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aurelia would like to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bashkim

texts.en:
In the photograph are Bashkim and his wife, Gashe, who is 80% blind. They are in their late 50s and are parents of two, one of whom was born completely blind. Gashe recently broke her hand too, and she has it in a cast. Bashkim needs this loan to pay for his wife’s eye surgery and for a new cast for her hand.

They have been pursuing agriculture these past 10 years; on the 9 dynym (9,000 square meters) agricultural land they own, they plant mainly beans and corn and some seasonal veggies in addition to harvesting from some fruit orchards. Their income, though, is the disability of Gashe and their blind son and also Bashkim, who is their caretaker, receiving $139/month, $112/month and $112/month.

“I can’t complain because there are people in a worse situation, unfortunately. I pray every day to have the strength to take great care of them," said Bashkim in the interview.

loans.use: to pay for eye surgery for his 80% blind wife and for changing the cast on her broken hand

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 31-year-old, married woman with four children and lives in a sector in Jordan called Marka. Amani is selling ready-made clothes in her home.

Her project started 5-year-ago and she runs her business alone. She is working hard to help her husband; they are building a second floor of their house for rent so as to raise their incomes.  They want to save money to provide a good education for their kids. 

The purpose of applying to the loan is to buy more ready-made clothes to sell and increase her profits, so she will be able more to help her husband.

loans.use: to buy more ready-made clothes to sell and increase her profits

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 30 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Cecile is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cecile has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter tiene la edad de 44 años, está en unión libre y tiene 5 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar inventario para su pulpería. Él se dedica a este negocio hace varios años ya y necesita mejorar la diversidad de productos en su local, para así ofrecerle a sus clientes mejor atención y diversidad de productos. El además de eso se dedica a ser taxista de personas en la comunidad como un segundo trabaja. La pulpería es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo cual va a invertir en ella. El espera mejorar sus ventas a partir de este mes y así generar más ingresos para crecer con su proyecto y ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Es la primera vez que solicita en FUDECOSUR y nunca antes había trabajado con Bancos Estatales.
texts.en:
Walter is 44 years old, married, and has five children who are his top priority.  

With this loan, he wants to purchase inventory for his grocery store.  He has worked at this business for many years and wants to improve the diversity of products that he offers so he can offer his customers better service and a larger choice of items.  He also works as a taxi driver for people in his community as a second job.  The grocery store is his main source of income, so he wants to invest in it.  

He hopes that his sales will improve starting this month and generate more income as his project grows, which will offer his family a better quality of life.  

This is the first time he is requesting a loan from FUDECOSUR and he has never worked with state banks.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his grocery store.

loans.name: Khabo

texts.en:
Khabo is a Business Management student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute. This is her story:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy most?
I am studying for a Bachelor of Business Arts. I enjoy meditating or consciousness classes. Math is the most enjoyable subject for me.

What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: In which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
My goal is to start my own business, since I will have the qualifications to do so (and the experience to do so). I want to work in the construction industry and be in a top management position. I would like to work in Durban. Yes, I would like to travel overseas.

Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I was born in Swaziland, and I have five brothers and five sisters. My parents are both unemployed. My dad was in an accident in 2012, and he had to leave work and go back to Swaziland. My mother has never worked in her life. I do not have children. I plan to have children after finishing my degree, when I am financially stable in life.

What do you like to do in your spare time?
I like to read motivational books and to listen to music. I also visit my friends, and we study or do homework.

How will Kiva change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
Kiva's loan can change my life, since I spend money on rent, transportation, and food. Since my parents are unemployed, I will be able to support myself through the loan and will be relieved from the stress of not being able to afford school.

loans.use: to pay for one year's tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Saleha

texts.en: Saleha is a 33-year-old divorced woman. After getting divorced from her husband, she decided to start a new life and to be a productive woman. Saleha has started her own business selling clothes at her house. Because her business is profitable, she is planning to expand it in the future by opening her own clothing store to increase her profit. Now, she is seeking a loan to buy a new collection of clothes for the upcoming season to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes to sell for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Rabihan

texts.en:
This is Rabihan, a villager who hasn’t finished one single class unfortunately.  According to her. “I don’t know how to write or to read. But in our villages back then we had no classes and no teachers, yet we had animals and nature and we got used to love these two, “said Rabihan petting her cow. 

She wants to add another dairy cow and this is why this lady needs your financial help.   The cow that they currently have covers only the family needs, thus the new one that she wants to buy will hopefully generate an income for her because they only live on $170/month retirement pension of her husband.    It will be her first time requesting a loan. 

Kindly note that the village where she resides is very far and no other MFI can reach the destination easy. And VFA is been doing an amazing job reaching out to the farthest rural areas to help anyone in need.

loans.use: to generate an income by buying a dairy cow to provide her only income

loans.name: Nhóm 03, Sơn Đồng, Yên Mỹ Group

texts.en:
Xoan has worked in agriculture raising cow for more than 10 years. She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
 
The main hardship that Xoan faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby cows to raise and sell in future.

In 2011, Xoan joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Xoan has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Xoan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cows to raise and sell in future

loans.name: 02 - Quang Trung - Phường Đông Hương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lanh is 53 years old and she is married with 1 child. Her husband is disabled. She has to work hard to take care her family and so her daughter can go to school.
 
She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling soft drink for more than 10 years.Lanh lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village. Although, she is a reputable person in the community.

 Lanh is group leader of the 02 - Quang Trung - Phường Đông Hương group with 7 members.
 This is Lanh first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drink to maintain her store. 
With her business profit, Lanh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to maintain her store

loans.name: Abd Al Aziz

texts.en:
Abd Al Aziz is 53 years old. He is married and has four daughters and two sons. Because of his financial situation, he did not complete his education.

Abd Al Aziz started his business, a kiosk where he sells coffee and other kinds of products.  The kiosk is located on a busy street. He requested a loan because he wants to pay for new products and a new coffee machine to increase his income. He dreams that his children will be able to grow up with a good education and that they will obtain good jobs so that they become good, respectable people that have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for new products and a new coffee machine to increase his income.

loans.name: 010002.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Bích is 52 years old and she is married.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Bích lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable .
 
The main hardship that Bích faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.
This is Bích's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Bích hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es: María tiene 40 años de edad vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos dos varones de 22 y 20 años y una hija de 17 años de edad, a los que junto a su esposo están sacando adelante en sus estudios. María se dedica a la fabricación de prendas de vestir para lo cual es muy solicitada por sus vecinos y otras personas que gustan de sus servicios, lo que le permite cada día tener mejores ingresos económicos. Por lo anterior María solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: telas, hilos de todos colores, agujas, elástico, botones y zipper, para cumplir con la demanda de productos que solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her three children, two boys, ages 22 and 20, and one daughter, age 17. Together, she and her husband are providing for them during their studies.

María makes articles of clothing for a living and her services are in high demand among her neighbours and other people who like her work. This allows her financial income to become greater each day. Because of this, María is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: fabric, multicoloured threads, needles, elastic bands, buttons and zippers, in order to keep up with demand for the products her clients want.

loans.use: to invest in fabric, mulitcoloured threads, needles, elastic bands, buttons and zippers, in order to keep up with demand for the products her clients want.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable farm.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending.

Arlene dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Shirley works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Shirley is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from balut vending. Aileen is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell to customers.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase stocks of groceries to sell.

Julie successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

NWTF is relisting Julie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ruaa's Group

texts.en:
Manal is a caring mother of four children, and she is a divorced woman who lives in Dair Alla with her kids.

Her husband left her without any income to help her provide a living for their small children, so she decided to start selling ready clothes, which provided her with a low income.

After her daughter Ruaa finished her university education in business administration, she could not find a job. Therefore, she started working with Manal to develop the business, and they opened an independent small shop for themselves.

Now they applying for a loan to help them buy more products to sell and to do good promotion for their shop to increase their incomes and achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her clothing shop and to do good promotion for her business to increase her income and achieve her dreams.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 42 years old and has six children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for eight years and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Cawaale Group

texts.en: Shamis is a 45 year-old woman who has five children, three boys and two girls. She is the one raising her hand in the group photo. Shamis is the leader of a group named Cawaale Group, which consists of five female and five male members. Each of the group members has an existing small or medium-sized business in Borama City. Shamis has a medium-sized retail shop in Borama. Shamis sells women's clothes, perfumes and also she sells TV screens, freezers,etc. She is a very hard-working woman as she pays all her children’s school fees. Shamis has requested a loan of $500 from Kaaba MFI to increase her working capital and also to buy electronics for resale. Cawaale Group members are part of a group, but each person has her/her loan separately, as they all have an existing business.

loans.use: To buy more electotics for her Retail Shop

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam is a married woman living in Irbid. She opened her beauty salon 10 years ago. Khetam is working hard to help her husband pay for their household expenses and to educate her three children.

Now she is asking for a loan to buy more salon equipment such as hair dryers, scissors, brushes and hair sprays, and to redecorate the salon to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment such as hair dryers, scissors, brushes and hair sprays

loans.name: Rbaiha

texts.en:
Rbaiha is a 35-year-old widow, she lives in Dairalla. Rbaiha is holding secondary school certificate, and she started her own business after her husband died.  

She opened a small grocery beside her home to get income and to insure her livings. She wants to depend on herself and be productive woman, her will power will help her to be a successful woman and achieve her dreams.

Rbaiha`s future plan is to increase income, she is applying for the loan, so she can get new merchandise in low price and less time, to increase her income.

loans.use: To get new merchandise at low prices and less time, to increase her income from her grocery store.

loans.name: Que

texts.en:
Mrs. Que is 53 years old. There are five people in her family.  She has been working in small business for more than 20 years so she is able to pay the loan monthly. 

She would like to borrow the loan to build a modern latrine, which can help to improve their living conditions and health for her family, especially her children and also contribute to environment protection.

loans.use: To build a modern latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai is a hardworking woman,  40 years old, she is married and has three children. 

The loan can help her to build a modern latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry. With more than 10 years experience and has support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: To build a modern latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 35-years-old married man from Khan Younis city. He is the father for one son and two daughters. Mustafa works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. Mustafa also works in transferring goods using a rickshaw. it is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Mustafa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one. This will help him to improve his business and also his income.
Mustafa appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to replace the old one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for her barn.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 59-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

Eva has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 48 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are sent in school.

Belen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Belen aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie is 33 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lorie is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lorie has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 57 years old and widow with four children. All of her children are attending school.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Josephine has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise livestock.

loans.name: Ma. Milagrosa

texts.en:
Ma. Milagrosa is 43 years old and married with nine children.  With seven children in school, Ma. Milagrosa works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Milagrosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Ma. Milagrosa has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Milagrosa would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy a new engine and other materials to repair her fishing boat.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Ma. Theresa's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine and other materials to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jovelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Jovelyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell to customers.

Jovelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Ergie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ergie works hard to support her family.

She has a  pig raising business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Ergie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ergie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Thuong

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuong is 55 years old, married and has four children, three of them have jobs. Husbandry and cultivation are main income source of her family. She can cover the family’s daily cost and education from selling vegetables, chicken, ducks and pigs. 

With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: To build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Rosana is 42 years old and has five children who are in school.

Rosana has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosana requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Rosana has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Rosana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Letecia is 53 years old and has four children who are in school.

Letecia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Letecia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for One Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Alfredo tiene 48 años de edad es constructor, tiene una hija que con mucho esfuerzo ha podido criar, y que hoy está estudiando ya para ser una médica. Alfredo es una persona muy luchadora que se esfuerza para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Se inició en el rubro hace más de 20 años, cuenta con 5 personas que trabajan con él. Comenta que pide este préstamo para poder refaccionar su casa, y poder comprar cementos, ladrillos, y otros.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 48 years old and works in construction.  He has a daughter who, with a lot of effort, he was able to raise, and who is now studying to be a doctor. Alfredo is a very determined person, who is driven by opportunities to help those closest to him. 

He started in his field of business more than 20 years ago, and has 5 people who work with him.  He comments that he is requesting this loan to be able to repair his home, and to buy cement, bricks and other materials.

loans.use: Comprar cementos, ladrillos, y otros para poder refaccionar casa.

loans.name: Esmilda

texts.es:
Esmilda tiene 44 años de edad,soltera,con dos hijos, vive en una zona rural del distrito de Nanchón, que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de San Miguel, región Cajamarca, en la Sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Esmilda se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 8 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Esmilda espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Esmilda is 44 years old. She is single and she has 2 children. She lives in a rural area of Nanchón which is located in San Miguel province within the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú. The residents in this region are mainly involved with farming, livestock and business.

Esmilda raises and sells small animals like chickens, ducks, turkeys and others. Her business is located at her home. She has eight years of experience with this business. She has very good personal and business references in the area. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more animals like chickens, ducks and turkeys as well as a balanced food for these animals. Esmilda hopes to offer better products to her customers in order to generate greater earnings and increase the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: purchase small animals and balanced food for those animals

loans.name: Daisy Joyce

texts.en:
Daisy Joyce is 24 years old and married with one child in school.

Daisy Joyce is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Daisy Joyce has been farming rice for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Daisy Joyce would like to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn is 41 years old and married with six children. With four of her children in school, Emilyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, where she sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, noodles and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Emilyn has been in this business for 18 years. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Wilma is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is divorced, caring mother for three children she is 42 and lives in Wihdat.
Since the separation of Ahlam from her husband, she became the sole breadwinner for her children, so because of that, she decided to exploit her capabilities in cooking, and started her own business.  

She is cooking sweets and food and deliver it on the time according the orders that has been received.
She lives with her mother and her three kids and she wants to provide them a living in any way.  She wants to see them complete their education to be able to find suitable jobs for them in the future.

Ahlam wants to develop her work and to purchase electric tools for the kitchen to help her in the speed of cooking and delivery of the order on time, also she wants to buy spices and food supplies, therefore she decided to apply for a loan.

She hopes to open her independent kitchen in the future and increase her customers.

loans.use: to purchase electric tools for the kitchen and to buy spices and food supplies

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a purified drinking water retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an Internet café. Doris is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of water to sell to customers.

Doris has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of water to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 43 years old and married with four children. 

Wilma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Wilma has been raising pigs for five years and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ledgyn

texts.en:
Ledgyn is 34 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are attend in school.

Ledgyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ledgyn requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ledgyn has been raising pigs for two years and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Ledgyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 40 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Gilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Gilda has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gilda aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Luz Omaira

texts.es:
Luz Omaira mujer de 30 años de edad, casada pero sin hijos, una mujer independiente, no se deja mandar, una persona que desde siempre mostro esa independencia ese carácter para seguir sus caminos, desde el año 2008 monto un negocio de tienda de abarrotes, el cual atiende 12 horas del día, este negocio le está sirviendo para aportar en su hogar, ayudar a su madre y desvía un pequeño monto de su ganancias a un ahorro para comprar una vivienda propia que es su gran sueño, una casa que ame por el esfuerzo que le costó, algo que  sea ella y nadie se lo pueda quitar ese es su sueño y hace que trabaje intensamente pro lograrlo.

Luz Omaira busca abastecer su negocio por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido en general de bebidas, tanto cervezas como refrescos, comprar abarrotes, granos y productos de aseo personal, la ayuda servirá para que su tienda siga siendo una de las más surtidas y completas del barrio., por eso ayuda, apoya esta mujer liberal que busca ser autosuficiente y no depende de su marido.
texts.en:
Luz Omaira is a 30-year-old woman. She is married but does not have children. She is independent; she doesn’t let herself be ordered. She is a person who has always shown this independence and this character to continue on her path. 

In 2008, she started a grocery store business, which she takes care of 12 hours per day. This business is allowing her to support her household, help her mother, and allocate a small amount of her earnings to save up for buying her own house. It is her big dream to have a house that she loves because of the effort it took to achieve. Her dream is to have something that is hers and that no one can take away. She has to work very hard to achieve this.

Luz Omaira wants to supply her business, so she requests a loan to buy general stock of beverages, including beer and sodas, and to buy groceries, including grains and personal use products. This loan will allow her store to continue being one of the best stocked ones in the neighborhood. 

For these reasons, help and support this progressive woman, who wants to become self-sufficient and to not depend on her husband.

loans.use: to buy general stock of beverages, including beer and sodas, and to buy groceries, including grains and personal use products.

loans.name: Manuel Esteban

texts.es:
Mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y poder ofrecerles una buena educación a sus 2 hijos son las metas que motivan a levantarse y trabajar duramente al señor Manuel (quien es el dueño del negocio), quien con su negocio de cría de gallinas ponedoras ha logrado ser útil y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. 

Manuel buscando ser más competitiva, más prospera frente a la competencia, perdurar en el tiempo, mejorar las ventas, tener mayor existencia en su granja quiere solicitar un crédito para construir un galpón y comprar gallinas ponedoras y tener una producción de huevos más alta y ser un distribuidor considerar.

Con tu ayuda Manuel Podrá pagar la educación de sus hijos que es uno de sus más grandes sueños, aporta hoy!
texts.en:
To improve the condition of his house and be able to offer a good education for his two children, these are the goals that motivate Manuel to get up every day and work hard.

He has a business raising laying hens, and this helps him support his household.

Manuel is applying for a loan to build a chicken coop and to buy more laying hens. He is looking to increase egg production and expand the business to distribution capacity. 

The loan will help his business to be more competitive, to stay ahead and successful over time. He will improve sales and more effectively run his farm.

With your help, Manuel will be able to pay for his children's education, which is one of his biggest dreams.

loans.use: to build a chicken coop and to buy laying hens.

loans.name: Bifuna Group

texts.en:
William 37, is married, with two children aged 1 and 3. He sells secondhand clothes in a trading centre seven kilometers away from the city center. He started the business after selling cows in the village and got capital to begin the business. 

He also joined a group of market traders in order to access loans to boost the business. He will use this particular loan to buy a bale of secondhand clothes that he will sell to his customers so that he can meet the demand and raise his income. He is hardworking and honest and, along with the group, thank Kiva lenders for the job well done and for promoting small enterpreneurs. 

The photo comprises the group members, two of whom are saving and acquiring the loan the following month. They all signed the client waiver form.

loans.use: to buy a bale of secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Erida

texts.en:
Erida lives in a village, yet she’s been selling fruits and veggies and also grains that she buys from other villagers, in the city of Korca at the farmers’ market. Erida, who still lives with her parents, is a single woman and is excited because she is getting married soon, as per her saying.

Here is what Erida said to the loan officer who interviewed her at the market where she was situated selling: “My father had a stroke recently that left him semi-paralyzed; thus, I’ve got to help my mother in her rural activities because it would be too much on her alone, and she couldn’t do it all anyhow. But doing all this, though, leaves me exhausted at the end of the day. That’s for sure.”

Your loan will help Erida buy fruits, veggies, and grains to sell at the farmers’ market.

loans.use: to buy fruits/veggies/grains to sell at the farmer's market in the city.

loans.name: Alberto Enrique

texts.es:
Alberto desde muy temprana edad aprendió el oficio de confección de zapatos y sandalias gracias a un amigo que le enseño el oficio, fue así como poco a poco Alberto empezó a entender y aplicar estos conocimientos.

Tiene 2 hijos que son su más grande adoración.
Es un hombre emprendedor, amoroso y siempre dispuesto a atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera.
Se siente muy agradecido con todo lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar.

Madruga todos los días para trabajar en sus negocio durante 7 horas.

El pide un apoyo económico para comprar insumos como cuero, agujas, pegas, entre otros.

Tiene muchas esperanzas en su negocio y conserva la ilusión de tener un taller mucho más grande en el que pueda ofrecer empleo y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alberto began learning the shoe- and sandal-making trade at a very early age, thanks to a friend who taught him the trade. This way, little by little, Alberto began to learn and apply these skills. He gets up early every day to work on his business for seven hours.

He has two children who are his greatest adoration. He is an enterprising and affectionate man, always ready to tend to his clients in the best way. Alberto feels very thankful for all that he has been able to build up to now with the help of the Interactuar Corporation. He is requesting financial assistance to buy supplies such as leather, needles, glue, and more.

Alberto has high hopes for his business and a dream of having a much larger workshop, where he could provide employment and grow his clientele.

loans.use: buy supplies such as leather, needles, glue, and more.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-years-old single man from Gaza city  He has a store for selling kids clothes. It is a good business and provide him with a good income. Ahmad would like to prepare his store for the new season.

Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of kids clothes for his store. 
Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of kids clothes for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, cement, gravel, sand, and wood so she can change the roof and corridor as soon as possible to give a better service to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María tiene 58 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos de 35, 30, 21 y 16 años de edad a los que ha logrado sacar adelante y eso la llena de orgullo. Ella presta sus servicios domésticos desde hace 10 años y por su amabilidad y experiencia es muy bien recomendada por amigos y vecinos. María desea reparar el techo de su vivienda y las paredes ya que estas son de lámina la cual se encuentra deteriorada,  por lo cual ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera y clavos para cambiar las láminas del techo y paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 8 years old and lives in her own home together with her partner and their 4 children, aged 35, 30, 21 and 16. She has provided for her family and she is very proud of this. 

She has worked as a maid for 10 years and she is highly recommended by friends and neighbours because of her friendliness and experience. María would like to repair the roof and walls of her home. They are made of corrugated metal and have deteriorated. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI, to invest in corrugated metal, wood and nails to replace the metal on the roof and walls of her home.

loans.use: to invest in corrugated metal, wood and nails to replace the metal on the roof and walls of her home.

loans.name: Mernalyn

texts.en:
Mernalyn is 39 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mernalyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mernalyn has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 46 years old, married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Lilia has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Lilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jisivil

texts.en:
Jisivil is 34 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children in school.

Jisivil is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Jisivil requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies for her livestock.

She has been raising livestock for five years and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jisivil would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As the married mother of five children, Elvira works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines and also earns income from food vending. Elvira is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more clothes to sell through her clothing sales business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her save enough money to attain her dreams: to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Teodola

texts.en:
Teodola is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store business.

Teodola dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es: Luis reside en una ciudad pequeña donde compra quesos y luego se traslada a otra ciudad donde existe un mercado más amplio y vende sus quesos los fines de semana para obtener una ganancia, a este negocio se dedica desde hace 4 años, también trabaja de albañil cuando le contratan y lo llevan a lugares muy lejanos de donde no puede regresar a su hogar por algún tiempo, Luis es casado y vive con sus 4 hijos, de los cuales tres asisten a la escuela y el de 3 años pasa en la casa con su mamá, Luis va a invertir el crédito en la compra de quesos para revenderlos, Luis es un hombre tranquilo que aspira mejorar su negocio para dedicarse más tiempo a la venta de quesos y pasar junto a su familia y seguir luchando por sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis lives in a small city where he buys cheeses and then on weekends he travels to another city where there is a bigger market and he sells the cheeses to make a profit.  He has been doing this business for 4 years.  He also works as a bricklayer.  When he is hired he is sent to places that are very far from where he lives and so he is unable to return home for some time.

Luis is married and lives with his 4 children of whom three are in school and the 3-year-old child spends his time at home with his mother.  Luis is going to invest the loan in the purchase of cheeses in order to resell them.  He is a calm man who aspires to improve his business so that he can dedicate more time to selling cheese so that he can spend more time together with his family and continue working hard for his children.

loans.use: to buy cheeses

loans.name: Pashke

texts.en: Pashke is in the photograph with Ervin, her son; she is 45 and he is 24 and they live in the northern part of the country. Pashke had a dairy cow that was old and she sold it for 100,000 Albanian Lek. To buy a young one she needs an additional of 50,000 Albanian Lek and this is why she is applying for this loan. In the 10 dynym of agricultural land that her family owns, she plants mostly wheat and fodder. As far as the family income concerns, her oldest son works full time doing labor work and her younger who is 16 works during the summer time as a security guard at a nearby beach. Her mother-in-law, who receives a retirement pension of not more than $100/month, lives with them thus, that’s another little income.

loans.use: to buy a young dairy cow

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene la edad de 74 años, está casado y vive con la esposa  actualmente. El  crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales para hacer un gallinero y además comprar los pollos  y el alimento para los  mismos. El desea engordarlos  venderlos  a los vecinos y en algunos negocios y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: José is 74 years old, is married and currently lives with his wife. He wants the loan to buy materials to make a chicken coop and also to buy chickens and food for them. He wants to fatten them to sell to his neighbors and a few businesses. In the future he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater financial stability, and he hopes to be able to keep growing as a person and as a producer. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had any other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR provided him with the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs and tables to put it next to his stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting and wood to improve the roof on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: ro purchase a television for her home

loans.name: Tuệ

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuệ is 52 years old, and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling shrimp for more than 10 years.

Tuệ lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. This region often suffers from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Tuệ is not having latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Tuệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Tuệ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Angela Tatiana

texts.es:
Angela Tatiana tiene 21 años de edad,conviviente, con un hijo, vive en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Angela se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Angela espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Angela Tatiana is 21 years old. She has a partner and one child. She lives in a rural area of the district of Oyotún, located in the Province of Chiclayo in Lambayeque region along the northern coast of Peru. The residents of this district are mainly engaged in agriculture, livestock, and trade. 

Angela earns her living breeding and selling small animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, and others. Her business is located in her own home. She has three years of experience in this business with very good personal and business references from the area. Her requested loan will be used to purchase a greater number of animals, such as hens, chickens, ducks, turkeys, and others, as well as the purchase of balanced feed for them. Angela hopes to offer a better product to her customers, which will allow her to generate more income and increase the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to increase her flock of small animals and purchase feed to raise them

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 53 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Rosana requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming rice for twenty years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF 4 times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a widowed woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has three children who are in school.

Nenita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 22 years old and married with one child.

Fatima earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Fatima has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 60 years old, single and lives in one of the poor sectors in Jordan  She is very ambitious woman and although for her age, she has a very youthful spirit.

Fatima a woman who wants to be an example for other women and wants to be productive for her community.  She started her own business which was an idea from her friends after she has prepared for a bazaar and exhibitions and she successful in that.

Fatima liked antiques from her childhood, she has collecting them and put it in her bedroom, because of that she started selling the antiques and wood, stone carving. To do promotion for her business she has participated in many exhibitions to increase her customers. 

Now she is applying for a loan because she wants to buy more products to become able to participate in the next bazaar and increase her sales and her profits.

loans.use: to buy more products so as to become able to participate in the next bazaar and increase her sales and her profits.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia. Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Sagrada Familia” conformada por 07 socios entusiastas que el transcurso del tiempo han demostrado que son personas responsables. Ella es Clara una de las socias de 34 años de edad soltera, Con  deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida, actualmente clara trabaja brindando servicio doméstico. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de labiales talcos colonias ya que piensa poner su negocio de venta de cosméticos a pedido. El grupo  “Sagrada Familia” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Clara es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo color amarillo.
texts.en: The “Sagrada Familia” group is made up of seven enthusiastic members who through time have shown themselves to be responsible. Clara is one of the members. She is 34 years old and single. With the desire to improve her quality of living Clara currently is providing domestic services. Later she is thinking of starting a small business. This new loan will be used as capital for the small business she is thinking of starting. The “Sagrada Familia” is grateful for the lenders at Kiva that make this loan possible as it allows them to continue to improve. Clara is the first on the left wearing the yellow shirt.

loans.use: for capital for her small business.

loans.name: Hormecinda

texts.es:
HORMECINDA DE 50 AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERA, CON CARGA FAMILIAR, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA CON SUS HIJOS,EN EL DISTRITO DE LAGUNAS, EN LA REGIÓN LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DEL PERÚ,ES UNA COMUNIDAD PEQUEÑA, EN LA QUE SU POBLACIÓN ESTÁ DEDICADA MAYORMENTE A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES, LA AGRICULTURA Y EL COMERCIO.

ELLA SE DEDICA A VENTA DE VERDURAS EN EL MERCADO, DESDE HACE MAS DE 5 AÑOS, NECESITA EL CRÉDITO PARA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO, EN LA COMPRA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS PARA AUMENTAR SU STOCK,LO CUAL LE GENERARA MAYOR VENTAS MENSUALES Y MEJORARA SU INGRESO A SU UNIDAD FAMILIAR, POR CONSIGUIENTE SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y LA DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
50-year-old Hormecinda is single and has dependents. She lives along with her children in a house that she owns. It is in the Lagunas district of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. It is a small community, in which the population mainly works in the raising and selling of animals, agriculture, and commerce.

For over 5 years, she has made her living by selling vegetables in the Nueva Parada Market in Cayalti. She needs the loan to invest in her business, to buy fruits and vegetables to increase her stock. This will give her higher monthly sales and improve her contribution to the family, which will improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to increase her stock

loans.name: Nhóm 02, Xuân Thịnh, Yên Mỹ Group

texts.en:
Phan has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years and she lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
 
The main hardship that Phấn faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.
In 2011, Phấn joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. 

Phấn has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Phấn hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 40 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Gina has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling vegetables.

Alma dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elisa

texts.en:
Ma. Elisa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Ma. Elisa dreams that one day She will be able to save enough money to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase meats, pastas, vegetables, and other ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Segundo Arturo

texts.es:
Segundo es casado, y tiene 4 hijos de los que una está estudiando, Segundo es un señor que junto a su esposo vive en el campo y se dedica a la agricultura de productos que se dan en este sector  y también compra  lotes de productos que ya están listos para la cosecha para comercializar cualquier tipo de estos producto que el compra. Segundo comenta que la compra de lotes sembrados y comercio de productos  es un buen negocio siempre y cuando se les dé el debido cuidado a los cultivos y que para esto paga a personas que le ayuden en sus cosechas, Segundo se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un adolecente, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como papas, alverja, habas, entre otros.  Este señor trabajador espira seguir trabajando y sacar adelante a sus
hijos.
texts.en:
Segundo is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. Segundo lives together with his partner in the countryside and works in agriculture with products typical of the region. He also purchases plots of land that are ready for harvest in order to sell the products. Segundo says that the purchase of planted plots and sale of these products is a good business, as long as the crops are cared for correctly, and this is why he pays people to help him with the crops. 

Segundo has worked in agriculture since he was a teenager. He will invest the loan in the purchase of products like potatoes, peas, lima beans, and others. He is a hardworking man hopes to continue working and support his children to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase products like potatoes, peas, lima beans, and others.

loans.name: Maria Belen

texts.es: Belen es una señora de 41 años, ella es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 23, 25 y 20 años de edad, de los cuales solo el menor está estudiando, son 9 años que Belen se dedica a su negocio de tienda que es el sustento de ella y sus hijos, el crédito lo va a utilizar comprando productos de tienda para mejorar su negocio y variar mas sus productos, lo que Belen aspira es que su negocio mejore y así dar la educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Belen, aged 41, is a single mother and has three children aged 23, 25, and 20 of whom only the youngest is still studying. Belen has run her store for 9 years, and the earnings have supported herself and her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stock for her store, to improve her business and provide a wider range of products. Belen hopes that her business will improve and she will be able to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a strong woman and a single mother who is devoted to providing the best life she can for her son. She currently works long hours at an educational institution helping students better themselves and pursue their dreams. Inspired by the very students she assists on a daily basis, Ruth decided to further her education and graduate from college. 

Ruth’s dream is to one day see her own son graduate college and begin his journey in life. Living with one income while maintaining a home and providing for her child has proved challenging. Not only does she support her son and household on her own, but she also pays for her educational expenses on her own as well. After her divorce, Ruth was left with a portion of her spouse’s debt. Although she has lived up to her obligations, the initial struggle of maintaining her living expenses and providing for her son on her own while paying off the debt has put a strain on Ruth’s credit. 

She is now well established in her life, but she is experiencing difficulty obtaining an affordable loan to replace her broken air conditioner. Her home has been extremely affected by the Florida summer heat. It is often a higher temperature inside of her home than outside. Living in such an overheated house has been hard on Ruth and her son, so she is hoping that SELF and Kiva can help her obtain an affordable loan to purchase a high efficiency air conditioner that will improve their living environment and quality of life. 

Not only will this loan help her purchase a new high efficiency air conditioner which will efficiently cool her home, it will help her save money on her electric bills and help rebuild her credit as she repays her loan. 
Ruth will use her Kiva loan to pay for a new high efficiency air conditioner that will improve living environment and quality of life for her son.

loans.use: to purchase a new high efficiency air conditioner that will improve the living environment and quality of life for her son.

loans.name: Tegal Sari Group

texts.en:
Members of the Tegal Sari group made their loan payments on time. Ni Ketut, 30, is group leader and has three children, including a newborn. As a housewife, she’s very responsible for her family and also the group she leads. The group raises pigs for six months and then sells to a buyer.They earned a satisfactory profit because the price for pork and demand were high. Ni Ketut's earnings fulfill her family's needs and she also sets aside some money for savings.
Although the group earned a satisfactory profit,Tegal Sari is proposing a new loan. Now, they are asking for a smaller loan because some of the group used their own money as capital for the pig business. The group's loan amount is 6.000.000 IDR. The loan will be used to increase the pip population, buy feed and vitamins and renovate the cages. Ni Ketut will use her portion of the loan to purchase superior piglets. Beside maintaining pigs, Ni Ketut also works at a fish canning factory. Ni Ketut hopes she can have enough savings and will continue to raise pigs with her own money.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets

loans.name: Tuugaita

texts.en: Tuugaita is 40 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling chips and pork puns in her community and has been doing this for two years. Tuugaita has requested a loan to buy sugar, flour, yeast, cooking oil, and a frying pan. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tuugaita hoped to extend her house and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy  flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, and frying pan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build his own room

loans.name: Nhóm 01, Thiện Na , Vạn Hòa Group

texts.en:
Mr Liệu is 45 years old and he is married. He is a fisherman for more than 10 years and lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
His family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Liệu faces is lack of capital.  He is requesting a loan to purchase more nets and tools for fishing.

In 2011, Liệu joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve his  business. Liệu has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With his business profit, Liệu hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more nets and tools for fishing to improve business

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique tiene 46 años conviviente. Vive en casa propia con hijo. Luis Enrique es persona con buenas referencias.Vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Habitada por gente trabajadora, que se dedican a la agricultura y ganaderia.

Él es conocido en el medio, por su labor de engorde y venta de ganado vacuno, y animales menores, tambien se desempeña como obrero en una empresa agroindustrial.El presente credito sera utlizado como capital de trabajo para la compra de animales menores para su crianza y venta,para de esa manera generar mayor ingreso mensual a su unidad familiar, y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique is 46 years old. He is partnered and lives with a child in a house he owns. Luis Enrique is a person with good references. He lives in a community located in Saña district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. It is inhabited by hard-working people, who work in agriculture and animal husbandry. 

He is known in the area for his work fattening and selling cattle and small animals. He also works as a laborer in the business Agroindustrial Cayalti. The current loan will be used as working capital to purchase small animals to raise and sell so, in this way, to bring more monthly income to his family, and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase small animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesa is 58 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Dionesa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Dionesa requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Dionesa has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Dionesa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
