Narcisa is a 42-year-old married mother of five children, four in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Narcisa has a food market business in the Philippines. Narcisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

Narcisa has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Orfilia

texts.es:
Orfilia es una mujer de 60 años de edad que solo tiene su negocio de venta de alimentos para mantener su hogar, puesto que no cuenta con un trabajo ni pensión alguna, solo sus habilidades culinarias para preparar platos típicos de la región antioqueña y un espíritu incansable de lucha y progreso.

Orfilia se encuentra solicitando un préstamo significativo pero que será de u enorme apoyo para su actividad y es que comprara insumos y materiales para lograr un aumento de producción para mejorar su calidad de vida y la facilidad y practicidad en la cocina.

El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de de un asador grande, compra de insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de alimentos, platos, vasos, cubiertos, desechables,  bolsas y empaquetes para llevar pedidos.

Ella es solitaria solo se tiene así misma apóyala incentiva su actividad con un préstamo
texts.en:
Orfilia is a 60-year-old woman who only has her business of selling food to support her household.  Since she does not have another job or a pension, she has only her culinary abilities of preparing traditional dishes of the Antioqueña region and her tireless spirit to fight and progress.

Orfilia is requesting a significant loan but it will be an enormous help for her business.  It is for buying supplies and materials to increase production in order to improve her quality of life and the ease and practicality in the kitchen.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of a large grill, supplies and ingredients for preparing food, as well as plates, glasses, cutlery, disposable goods, bags, and packages for carrying orders.

Orfilia is lonely and only has herself; support her and encourage her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients in order to prepare food, as well as to buy plates, glasses, cutlery, disposable goods, bags, and packages for carrying orders.

loans.name: Ngọ

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngọ is 49 years old, and she is married with three children. She lives with one dependent in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Ngọ has a retail business selling cake, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. She has been involved in this business for nine years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Ngọ is not having latrine. Her family shares a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Ngọ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Ngọ hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a brick floor in his home

loans.name: Đa

texts.en:
Mrs. Đa is 57 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years.

Đa lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover this region often suffers from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Đa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.  Đa hopes to repay on time, for her business to do well, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: N7 Tiên Thắng Qlợi-Fly Chicken Group

texts.en:
Tới is 28 years old and married.
 
She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry for five years.
Tới lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Tới faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry to raise and sell in the future.
Tới is a reputable person in the community. Although this is her first loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, all members agreed to vote her in as the  the leader of this solidarity group. 
With her business profit, Tới hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Nhóm 05, Đồng Thọ,vạn Hòa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thong is 51 years old and she is married.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Thong lives in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Thong faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

In 2010, Thong joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Thong has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Thong hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: 060002.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Công is 42 years old and she is married.
 
She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling liquor, beer, and snacks for 5 years.  Công lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
 
The main hardship that Công faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase chickens to resell for a better profit.

In 2012, Công joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Công has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Công hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to resell for a better profit

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu is a hard working woman, 53 years old. She lives with four children. She would like to improve her living standard. 

The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine and she is able to repay the loan from cultivation and husbandry.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 52 years old, married with ten children. Three of her children are attending school.

Guillerma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries.

Guillerma has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Guillerma aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Tusipepa

texts.en:
Tusipepa is 27 years old and single with three children. She runs a small business selling chips and pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Tusipepa has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, a frying pan, etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Tusipepa will extend her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Absalon

texts.es:
Absalón tiene 67 años de edad, vive con su esposa, sin hijos a su cargo, viven en el Caserío Cabramayo, que pertenece al distrito de Colasay, Provincia de Jaén, Región Cajamarca, Sierra Norte de Perú.

Él está dedicado a las labores de maestro de construcción, actividad que desarrolla hace 04 años de forma independiente, en el caserío donde vive, goza de buenas referencias, cliente requiere el presente crédito para realizar compra de materiales de construcción para realizar la construcción de un contrato que tiene pendiente,con esto el cliente tendrá más comodidad para realizar sus labores, permitiéndole mayores ingresos, y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Absalón is 67 years old and lives with his wife without any dependent children. He lives in the hamlet of Cabramayo, which is part of the District of Colasay in the Province of Jaén located in the Cajamarca region of the northern Peruvian mountains. 

He earns his living doing the work of a master of construction, an activity that he began 4 years ago independently. He works in the village where he lives and has good references. He requires a loan to purchase building materials for a pending construction contract with a customer. He will be better able do his work, allowing for more income which can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for pending jobs

loans.name: Xochilt De Jesus

texts.es: Xochilt es una joven emprendedora de 20 años de edad, casada y con muchos deseos de superación ella se dedica a la venta de productos zermat, satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes, el negocio lo inicio con ahorros propios, sin embargo desea aumentar la oferta de productos, por tal razón solicita el financiamiento para la compra de perfumes, bodys, cremas, pinturas de labio, brillos y maquillaje.
texts.en: Xochilt is a young, 20-year-old entrepreneur, married, and with a drive to succeed. She sells Zermat products to satisfy the needs of her customers. She started her business with her own savings, however she would like to increase her supply of products. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, body lotions, creams, lipsticks, lip gloss, and makeup.

loans.use: buy perfumes, body lotions, creams, lipsticks, lip gloss, and makeup.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.

Helen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell.

Helen has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl works hard to support one child. She is married and has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines.

Cheryl requested a PHP 6,750 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Cheryl is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong, 31 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman living with her husband and her two lovely daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and livestock breeding. The married couple received 5000 square meters of cultivated land from their parents when they moved to live separately from their parents. The annual income of the family after deducting all costs is just enough to cover their living expenses and save a small amount. 

Now Mrs. Huong intends to raise pigs to have meat for sale but that saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to invest in pig breeding. 

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest well in the breeding, and then next year she can sell one to two tons of pig meat.

loans.use: to raise pigs

loans.name: Sau's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. SaƯ was born in 1984 in Vietnam; she is, however, of Thai ethnicity. Since January 2007 she has been a member of M7 Microfinance Institution, a forerunner to Kiva. She currently lives with her husband and two children, a daughter and son, in Mai Son district, Son La province. She is also the leader of this group of borrowers.

Mrs. SaƯ and her family farm and breed animals. The family has about one hectare of cultivated land, but each year the income after deducting costs of fertilizer, seed and breeding stock is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family. She also puts aside a small amount of money.

The family’s two children are school aged, so she wants to have money to pay for and invest in their education, but the amount she is able to save for this is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a 39,000,000 VND loan to be apportioned among the members of her group. Her share will be used to cover the tuition for her children.

Mrs. SaƯ feels this education loan will ultimately mean a better life for her children. She will work hard to earn the money to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Rhea Joy

texts.en:
Rhea Joy works hard to support one child. She is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Rhea Joy requested a PHP 6,750 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Rhea Joy is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As the married mother of four children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a shoe sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Vilma is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of bags and footwear to offer for sale.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of bags and footwear to offer for sale.

loans.name: Liaina

texts.en:
Liaina is 31 years old and married with four children. For the past three years she has worked a small plantation where she grows ‘ava, or kava, to earn a living.

Liaina has been a member of SBPD since 2013. She has applied for a loan to buy chemicals, weed spray, bush knives, etc. With the profits from her plantation, Liaina hopes to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed spray, bush knives, etc. to grow kava

loans.name: Empresarios De Los Olivos Group

texts.es: Fany es una mujer emprendedora de 30 años madre soltera de una hija de 16 años de edad, pertenece al grupo Empresarios de los Olivos, se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos en un mercado cerca a su casa,donde sus principales clientes son personas vecinas y gente que sabe del buen producto fresco que vende,Fany ha luchado mucho para obtener el puesto en el cual hoy se encuentra ya que al inicio solo contaba con un puesto alquilado y tenia que pagar diariamente por ello, ahora es propio, eso le  permite poder ahorrar y seguir invirtiendo, Fany ha  sabido vencer muchos obstáculos en su vida, eso le ha permitido levantarse y sacar adelante a su menor hija sin ayuda de nadie del cual se siente muy orgullosa,Fany agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el prestamo otorgado ya que le permitirá incrementar más su negocio para darle mejor calidad de vida a su menor hija, quien la ayuda los fines de semana en el negocio.Fany dice "Gracias Kiva seguiré luchando por mis sueños hoy mañana siempre con la ayuda de ustedes"
texts.en:
Fany is an enterprising 30 year old single mother with a 16 year old daughter. She belongs to the "Empresarios de los Olivos" communal bank. She works selling fish and seafood in a market close to her house where her main clients are neighbors and people who know the good fresh product that she sells.

Fany has worked hard to obtain the stall she is in now as at the beginning she had a rented stall that she had to pay for daily. Now she has her own and this allows her to be able to save and continue to invest. Fany has overcome many obstacles in her life and this has allowed her to get back up and raise her young daughter with no aid from anyone and she feels very proud of this.

Fany is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan awarded as it allows her to expand her business more and provide a higher quality of living for her daughter who helps her on the weekends with the business.

Fany says " Thank you Kiva. I will continue to fight for my dreams, today, tomorrow and every day with your help".

loans.use: to stock her business buying fish, crabs and other kinds of seafood.

loans.name: Ma. Editha

texts.en:
Ma. Editha is 35 years old and married with eight children. Three of her children are sent to school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Editha is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Editha has been farming sugarcane for eight years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Anh, born in 1993, is a Thai ethnic woman who joined in the program of M7-MFI in January 2014. Even since she was a new member, she has always been a good exemplary member of her group in compliance with the regulation and policies of the organization. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province. 
	
Her family’s main occupation is breeding (pig breeding) with about three pig herds for sale for the whole year, which brings the annual income from VND 70 to 80 million. However, after deducting all costs, the income is just enough to cover the living expense of her family and a small amount of saved money. She wants to expand the breeding model, but the saved amount is not enough to buy breeding pigs and food for it. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to invest in the breeding.
	
She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding with high productivity, and then the breeding will bring her family a considerable profit next year.

loans.use: to expand their breeding model.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 62 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Violeta has a food market business in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more spices to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is 70 years old and married with eight children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. Amelia has requested a loan to buy cooking oil, flour, baking powder, and sugar. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Amelia will support her family and save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, baking powder, and sugar.

loans.name: 08 Tây Ga Phú Sơn1 - Timely Group

texts.en:
Hương is 51 years old and married.

She has had a retail business selling clothes for more than 10 years.
Hương lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region. 
Mai is a reputable person in the community. Although this is her first loan from theThanh Hoa microfinance institution, all members agreed to vote for her to be the leader of 08 Tây Ga Phú Sơn1 - Timely solidarity group.  She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to resell.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en: Alisa is 55 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Alisa has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, baking powder, sugar, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Alisa will support her family.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, baking powder, a bag of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Alalamailematuatala

texts.en:
Alalailematuatala is 35 years old and a married woman with 4 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for  years. 

Alalailematuatala has requested a loan to buy sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, coconut, etc. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. Alalailematuatala will use her earnings to support her family financially and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, coconut, etc..

loans.name: N33 - Tây Ga -Phú Sơn - Raise Income Group

texts.en:
Hiền is 39 years old and married with two children.
 
She has had a retail business selling mobile phone cards for more than 10 years.
Hiền lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Hiền faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase mobile phone cards to resell.
This is Hiền first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to repair her house because her family is living in a very small and cramped house.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone cards to resell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a hard-working entrepreneur with three children.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Mary Jane dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to continue to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 49 years old, and she is married with four children. 

Leonora is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Leonora has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Deborah is 47 years old and has five children who are in school. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

Deborah has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Deborah would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Minh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh, born in 1991, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of three members, including her husband and her daughter. Currently, her family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation, and they have about 1.2 hectare of cultivated land for coffee and rice. The income from each harvest after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and a small amount saved. But, because she has to pay much for her daughter’s education, that saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to pay for her daughter’s education fees. 

She hopes the loan amount will help her daughter have a better condition for learning, and she will have a brighter future. Mrs. Minh will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s education fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 54 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a manicure service in the Philippines. 

Nenita has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her manicure services. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her manicure services.

loans.name: Khap's Group

texts.en:
Khap was born in 1979 in Vietnam; she is, however, of Thai ethnicity. She is married and has two sons. The family lives in Mai Son district, Son La province. She is also the leader of this group of borrowers.

Both Khap and her husband are civil servants. Because both of her sons are school aged, she has to watch money very closely in order to pay her sons’ tuition and have enough money to cover the family’s living expenses.

To increase her income Khap wants to raise chickens and pigs, but she hasn’t the capital to invest in this venture. She wants now to borrow 70,000,000 VND through Kiva's field partner M7-MFI for her group, and she will use her portion to start her business.

Khap believes that this loan will help her raise her livestock especially well, which should lead to considerably good profits next year. She will work hard to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to raise and sell chickens and pigs

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie works hard to support her family. Arcelie is married with four children, and she has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Arcelie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

Arcelie has been in this business for 25 years, and also earns income from raising pigs and motorcycle transportation.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with one children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marissa is 32 years old and has one child who is in school.

Marissa has a general store business in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for five years. In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Charron

texts.en:
Charron is 34 years old and married with two children.

Charron works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 31,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products.

Charron has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Charron aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products

loans.name: Dieu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dieu, born in 1972, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her three daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her oldest daughter is at grade 9, and the other two are at kindergarten.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding. They have about 9,000 square meters of cultivated land, so the income from each harvest after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of the whole family and a small saved amount of money. However, that saved amount is not enough to pay and invest in her children’s education. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.
	
She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and is hoping that the loan amount can help her children have better conditions for learning and then that can bring them a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay and invest in her children's education.

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hanh, 26 years old, has been participating in the program of M7-MFI since January, 2009. She currently lives with her parents-in-law, her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is farming, so the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of the whole family and save a small amount of money. 

She wants to buy a buffalo to assist the family in ploughing, but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.
	
She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have enough money to buy a healthy buffalo to assist all members of the family in ploughing, and to bring her family effective farming production.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.en:
Bernardino is a father of three children and has worked as a carpenter for the past 22 years. He does this work to support his children. 

He requested a loan to purchase carpentry materials. Having these items will increase his income and enable him to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase carpentry materials

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nhóm 02-Phố 4-P.đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Châm is 57 years old, and she is married.
 
Châm has had a retail business selling cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk, and general items for more than 10 years. She lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household. Moreover, the market demand in this region is low. 

In 2009, Châm joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. 

Châm is a reputable member of her community. She is the group leader of Nhóm 02-Phố 4-P.Đông Sơn solidarity group. The main hardship that she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

With her business profits, Châm hopes to improve her business. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like her general store.

Gina dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Bernabeth

texts.en:
Bernabeth is 26 years old and married with two children.

Bernabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, personal care products and other supplies.

Bernabeth has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Bernabeth aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, personal care products and other supplies

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 58 years old and widowed with six children.

Eva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products.

Eva has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from tricycle transportation.

Eva aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 37 years old and married, with four children who are currently in school. Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products.

Evangeline has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products

loans.name: Alex Hernan

texts.es:
Alex Hernán tiene 40 años y se dedica a la producción de café bajo distintos sellos de certificación tales como: comercio justo y Rain Forest, está casado con Norma Iris con quien ah tienen 3 hijos bajo su cargo, ellos trabajan en conjunto para sacar adelante a su familia, ellos tienen como única meta darles todo lo mejor que este dentro de sus posibilidades a sus hijos.
Alex quiere entrar al programa de certificación orgánica que dirige COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, la producción de café bajo sellos de certificación es algo nuevo en la región y muy novedoso ya que permite obtener mejores ganancias por el café además de que ayuda a proteger la biodiversidad de la región. 
En estos momentos Alex quiere convertir 1 a producción orgánica  para lo que necesita comprar varios materiales como ser: plantas de café, abonos orgánicos, fungicidas e insecticidas orgánicos, pago de mano de obra con las ganancias extras de su parcela orgánica Alex espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Un crédito ayudara a Alex a convertir su parcela a producción orgánica lo que le permitirá tener mercados fijos para su café y a mejores precios, lo que le da sostenibilidad a su cultivo de café.
texts.en:
Alex Hernán is 40 years old. He is dedicated to the production coffee with distinct certification seals like free trade and rainforest. He is married to Norma Iris and they have three children. They work together to take care of the family. They only have one goal which is to give the best that they can to their children. 
Alex wants to join the organic certification program, through COCAFCAL, where he is a member. The production of coffee under certification seals is something new in the region and very innovative. It allows him earn better profits from the coffee and also helps to protect the biodiversity of the region. 
At this time, Alex wants to convert to an organic production, so he needs various materials like coffee plants, organic fertilizers, fungicides, and insecticides as well as  payment for laborers. With the extra earnings, Alex hopes to improve his family's living conditions. 
A loan will help Alex convert his land into an organic plot which will allow him to have permanent markets for his coffee with better prices. This gives sustainability to coffee cultivation.

loans.use: buy coffee plants as well as the organic fertilizers, insecticides and pesticdies neccesary to convert 0.75 hectares of coffee into an organic plot.

loans.name: Zuvaidahan

texts.ru: Зувайдахан, 45 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У Зувайдахан- среднее образование, он знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Стартовав с покупки скота на 8,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду Зувайдахан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, лошадь. Для содержания скота есть все условия: сарай и отгонные пастбища. На участке мерою 1,64 Га, он выращивает картофель и кукурузу. Зувайдахан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 6 овец и кукурузы в качестве корма для скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Зувайдахан развить бизнес и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Zuvaidahan is 45 years old, married, and has three children. Zuvaidahan has a secondary education. She knows how to use and plan her funds correctly in order to achieve her goals. She rears animals and grows crops as the main source of income for her family. Having started with the purchase of livestock for 8,000 som (KGS), thanks to Zuvaidahan's hard work today she has three cows and a horse. She has all the conditions for keeping livestock: a barn and pasture land. She grows potatoes and corn on a 1.64 plot of land. Zuvaidahan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy six sheep and corn for livestock feed. The proceeds of the loan will enable Zuvaidahan to develop the business and save up to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy six sheep and corn for livestock feed in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Unai

texts.en: Unai is a 53-year-old woman who is married with eight children. She runs a business sewing and selling elei clothes in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Unai has requested a loan to buy a material, colored paint, a board (upeti) etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a board (upeti), materials, colored paint, etc.

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He has two children. He supports his family to sustain a living.

He availed a loan amount of PHP 40,000 for his medical check-up. Necitas is fortunate to be part of the PMPC family.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: N4-Phố7-Quảng Thắng - Poor But Fun Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thái is 41 years old and she is married. She has had a manufacturing business making stone stairs for more than 10 years. Thái lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. 

In 2014, Thái joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thái has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is a reputable person in the community and the leader of "N4-Phố7-Quảng Thắng - Poor but fun" solidarity group. The main hardship that Thái faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase material to make stone stairs to sell. With her business profits, Thái hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make stone stairs to sell.

loans.name: Anna May

texts.en:
Anna May is 31 years old, married, and has three children.

Anna May is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Anna May has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Universo Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario UNIVERSO, está conformado por tres mujeres (ELBIRA SENAIDA, MARLENE REBECA y NIDIA) de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios de productos básicos; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace aproximadamente 2 años para poder obtener préstamo en Pana Pana.

ELBIRA SENAIDA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer jovial de 27 años de edad, está casada con 2 hijos: El mayor de 11 años estudia su tercer grado de primaria y una pequeña de 3 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como albañil. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos y colaborar con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, desde hace 11 años vende mariscos y pescados de manera ambulante está solicitando su cuarto financiamiento para diversificar sus productos y vender frijoles cocidos en su vivienda de tambo y madera, con los créditos anteriores otorgados por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido ir creciendo poco a poco y comprar productos básicos como chiverías, aceite y arroz, para establecer una pequeña pulpería. Ella sueña con vender ropa usada.
texts.en:
"Universo" [Universe] solidarity group is composed of three women (Elbira Senaida, Marlene Rebeca, and Nidia) of the Miskita ethnic group of the city of Bilwi, municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are entrepreneurial women who work day by day with the determination to achieve growth of their basic products' small businesses. They were organized as a solidarity group approximately 2 years ago to be able to get loans in Pana Pana.

Elbira Senaida: 
She is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a jovial woman of 27 years old, married with 2 children: the oldest, 11 years old, is studying his third grade, and a 3-year-old young girl. Her husband works as a builder informally. With the purpose of having her own source of income and collaborate with the household expenses and education of her children, for 11 years she has been selling seafood on the streets. She is requesting her fourth loan to diversify her products and sell cooked beans in her stilt and wood home. The previous loans granted by Pana Pana and funded by Kiva have enabled her to grow little by little and to buy basic products like dairy products, oil, and rice to establish a small grocery store. She dreams of selling used clothing.

loans.use: to buy 10 quintals of beans.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 47 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread, and personal care products.

Edelyn has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the a general store for four years, and also earns an income from food vending. Edelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread, and personal care products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and the water source.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could avail financial assistance for her chosen business. 

Francisca has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Francisca wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 62 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Dolores has been in this business for 10 years.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Dolores would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like condiments, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 63 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

Susana has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Virginia Carolina

texts.es: Virginia es una mujer laboriosa de 43 años de edad, madre soltera que lucha día a día para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos para darles un mejor futuro, ella se dedica a la comercialización de productos Avon y Zermat, desde hace seis años, solicita por séptima vez el financiamiento de ADIM, porque desea aumentar sus ventas, con el aumento de la oferta de productos, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de perfumes, cremas, labiales, sombras, vanidades y marbellí uno de sus logros con los créditos anteriores fueron mantener el negocio y realizar los pagos en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Virginia, age 43, is hard-working woman.  She is single, and she struggles day to day in order to get her two children ahead and to give them a better future.  She has been selling Avon and Zermat products for six years.

She is requesting a loan from ADIM for the seventh time.  She is doing so because she wishes to increase her sales by increasing the products that she sells.  She is requesting the loan to buy perfumes, creams, lipsticks, eye shadows, compacts, and mascara.

One of her achievements with the previous loans was maintaining her business and making her payments according to the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, lipsticks, eye shadows, compacts, and mascara.

loans.name: Arcadio

texts.en:
Arcadio is a loyal member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. He is married with three children. 

Recently, Arcadio availed an amount of PHP 40,000 to buy medicine and vitamins for maintenance for himself. Arcadio is thankful to PMPC for the help given.

loans.use: To buy medicine and vitamins for maintenance

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jonalyn is 52 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Jonalyn has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like cloth, needles, thread and maintenance for her business.

Jonalyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like cloth, needles, thread and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Genesis

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Genesis works hard to support her family.
 
She has a buy and sell of personal care products business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending.  Genesis is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more personal care products like cologne, lotion, etc. for her buy and sell of personal care products business.

Genesis has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products like cologne and lotion

loans.name: Rostica

texts.en:
Rostica is 57 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rostica has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Rostica has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gerlie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gerlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Methozela

texts.en: Methozela is a piggery owner from the municipality of Ronda, Cebu. She is 28 years old and has been raising hogs for two years now. From this business, she usually earns 10,000 PHP every four months when it is time to sell her fattened hogs. She is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and sacks of feed to keep her animals healthy. Methozela hopes to make her planned expansion possible with the help of the loan. In the future, she hopes to make her business more successful so she can save for her five-year-old son's future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 36 years old and lives in Pagadian City. 

She operates a sari-sari store business in their community. She has been doing this for five years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase feeds and other stocks for her sari-sari store business. 

In the future, Eva hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other stocks for her sari-sari store business

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace operates a retailing business in Pagadian. She is married with three children. She has been a member of PMPC since May 31, 2007. 

Recently, she availed a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy more items such as ready-to-wear and used clothing or " ukay-ukay." Through her loan, she adds an additional income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as ready-to-wear and used clothing or " ukay-ukay"

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old and married with five children. With three of her children in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Evelyn has been in this business for nine years. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 58 years old and married.

Josefina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

Josefina has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Fideles

texts.en:
Fideles is 49 years old and widowed with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread, and personal care products .

Fideles has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread, and personal care products

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 54 years old and married with four children. Irene works very hard to provide for them.

Irene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Irene has been in this business for three years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Irene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Marile

texts.en:
Marile is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marile is 56 years old now.

Marile has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials.

Marile has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Marile would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for seven years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sakcs of rice to sell

loans.name: Marefe

texts.en:
Marefe is 45 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Marefe is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marefe has been farming sugarcane for three years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Leony Ann

texts.en:
Leony Ann is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leony Ann is 37 years old and all of her children are currently in school.

Leony Ann has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines. Leony Ann requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Leony Ann has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Martha Oliva

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer casada, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, trabajó con su familia en  diferentes negocios donde adquirió experiencia en las ventas. 

Desde hace 4 años inició con una tienda de abarrotes para trabajarla como independiente y  labora desde las 7:00 am a 10:00 pm  

Martha sueña con tener un supermercado a futuro, por lo pronto con el crédito solicitado desea adquirir al por mayor una gran variedad de productos como verduras, granos, frutas, hortalizas etc., y poder brindarle a sus clientes artículos de excelente calidad. 

Con este negocio ha podido salir adelante poco a poco e intentara mejorar su vida y la de su familia al lado de la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Martha is married, and she is a very hard-working and responsible person.  She worked with her family in different businesses where she acquired sales experience.

Four years ago she started a grocery store in order to work there independently.  She works from 7:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.

Martha dreams of having a supermarket in the future.  In the meantime, she will use the requested loan to get a big variety of products wholesale.  She will get products like vegetables, grains, fruit, and greens, etc.  This way she will be able to provide her customers with excellent quality items.

With this business she has been able to get ahead little by little.  She will try to improve her life and that of her family with the Interactuar Corporation and the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to get a greater variety of products wholesale like vegetables, grains, fruits, and greens, etc.

loans.name: Socorro Elizeth

texts.es: Socorro es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y laboriosa, tiene 45 años de edad es casada y madre de un hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de acero, ropa y zapatos, ella le da una parte de mercadería a su hermana para que le ayude a vender en una tienda, solicita por décima vez el financiamiento de ADIM, porque desea invertir en la compra de pulseras, anillos, cadenas y omega, es una microempresaria con visión y uno de sus proyectos es lograr poner su propia tienda en el aeropuerto del país.
texts.en: Socorro is s responsible, hard- working and enterprising woman. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of a son. She works selling steel jewellery, clothing and shoes. She gives part of her merchandise to her sister who helps her sell in a store. She is requesting her 10th loan from ADIM as she wants to invest in buying bracelets, rings, chains and Omega necklaces. She is a micro-entrepreneur with vision and one of her projects is to open her own store in the country's airport.

loans.use: to buy bracelets, rings, chains and Omega necklaces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: wholesale corn and fruit like papaya, watermelon and melon to earn a better income.

loans.name: Gladys Del Socorro

texts.es: Gladys es una mujer de 45 años de edad casada, madre de tres hijos, una microempresaria laboriosa y esforzada, muestra de eso son las distintas actividades a las que se dedica, para generar dinero y salir adelante, primero inicio con la venta de nacatamales los fines de semana, luego puso una venta de ropa y adornos en su domicilio. Tiene 12 años de experiencia en el negocio y solicita por novena vez el financiamiento de ADIM para lograr comprar camisas, pantalones, faldas e ingredientes para elaborar nacatamales, con el crédito anterior logro emprender un nuevo negocio que es la venta de queso, ella es una mujer perseverante y trabaja  por lograr su próxima meta que es la compra de un carrito de hot-dog.
texts.en: Gladys is a 45 year old woman who is married and has three children.  She is a hard-working and dedicated micro-entrepreneur.  Evidence of that comes from the various activities that she dedicates herself to in order to generate income and get ahead  First she began selling nacatamales (corn meal, meat, and rice wrapped in banana leaves) on the weekends.  Then she started a clothing and household decorations business.   She has 12 years of experience in the business and she is asking for her ninth loan via Kiva field partner ADIM.  She will buy shirts, pants, skirts and ingredients for making nacatamales. With her previous loan she was able to start a business selling cheese. She is a persevering woman and she is working to achieve her next goal which is to buy a hot dog cart.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts, and ingredients for making nacatamales.

loans.name: Libetha

texts.en:
Libetha is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Libetha is 51 years old and one of her children is in school.

Libetha has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Libetha requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials such as thread, needles, garments, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Libetha has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Libetha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as thread, needles, garments, etc.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ludivina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ludivina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Ludivina has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Ludivina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lina works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods.  Lina is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell for her rice-retailing business.

Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a woman with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marissa is 28 years old now.

Marissa has a business selling rice in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marissa has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marissa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a widowed woman with seven children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lourdes is 62 years old.

Lourdes has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Beatriz Maria

texts.es:
Beatriz, es una mujer de 54 años de edad que desde hace algún tiempo se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales pero siempre con un deseo en su mente que era el incursionar en el área comercial, fue así como desde inicios del año 2012 monto su negocio ofreciendo accesorios para celulares, papelería, cosméticos, con el cual ha tenido gran acogida durante los años que lleva de funcionamiento. 
Trabaja con 1 empleado que es un familiar suyo durante 10 horas todos los días.

Beatriz se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar un crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía como accesorios, ropa, papelería, entre otros, con el fin de darle una mejor imagen al negocio, que logre atraer más clientes y así ofrecerles una variedad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de todos los que visiten el negocio. 

De esta manera logrará obtener ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para montar varias sucursales de su negocio y así tendrá un futuro más próspero, donde podrá mejorar notoriamente su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a 54 year old woman who for some time now has worked in various activities but always with the goal in mind of beginning a micro-business.  In 2012 she began her own business selling accessories for cell phones, as well as stationary and cosmetics.  Her business has been well-received since it opened.  She works with one employee who is a relative and they work 10 hours per day. 

Beatriz is known for being an entrepreneurial woman with vision and a great desire to get ahead.  For this reason she has decided to ask for a loan, in order to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as accessories, clothing, stationary, and other items.  Her goal is to offer her business a better image in order to attract more customers and offer them a variety of products in order to satisfy their needs and desires. 

In this way she will obtain income in order to continue offering economic support to her family and to save in order to begin various branches of her business and thus prosper in the future.  This will allow her to improve notably her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as accessories, clothing, stationary, and other items.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 43 years old, and she is married with 8 children. She lives in a rural village on the island of Savaii in Samoa where she also owns and operates a small general store. She has been running her business for 6 years now, selling a variety of products including flour, canned goods, toiletries, and homemade biscuits.

Luisa became a microloan borrower with South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2009, and she has since successfully borrowed and repaid 6 loans. With her first loan of about 250 USD, she started selling cigarettes. 

Based on her successful history, Luisa has become eligible for a small-business loan. She wishes to start another small retail store where she will sell her own biscuits and half moon pies.

Luisa saves her profits to both expand her business and pay for her children's education. In the future, she hopes to open yet another store in her village.

loans.use: to buy both a freezer and cooler, as well as a bag each of sugar, rice, and flour.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking mother who patiently manages her restaurant business. She also accepts orders of food for lunch and snacks to cater for special occasions, like seminars. Her earnings usually go for their daily household expenditures, while some is used as revolving capital to be able to accommodate all her customers’ orders. 

Marites wants to cook more menu items for more choices for her customers, whom she serves in her restaurant. With this, she is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and ingredients she uses in cooking the menus. She hopes to further grow the business and earn moe income for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and ingredients she uses in cooking the menus.

loans.name: Emma Lou

texts.en:
Emma Lou is 28 years old, married, and has two children who are still in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Emma Lou has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig. She has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 59 years old; she is widowed with two children.

Nida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products .

Nida has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Nida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 55 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

Anita has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 50 years old and married with two children. He earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. He is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise his pigs.

Alfredo has been raising pigs for 19 years and also earns additional income from food vending. He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream, to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise his pigs.

loans.name: Adriana Maria

texts.es:
Adriana es una madre de dos hijos por los cuales ha luchado incansablemente para sostenerlos y brindarles todo lo que necesitan.

Encontró en la venta de mercancía como artículos para el aseo personal, la manera para generar buenos ingresos estando cerca de sus hijos.

Hoy en día está iniciando con un capital muy pequeño y está en etapa de recolección de clientes, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos como cremas de manos, desodorantes, lociones, enjugues, entre otros, al por mayor y así poder abastecer su pequeño negocio con productos de calidad, los cuales ofrece  través de catálogos.

Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá impulsar su negocio y tendrá una mejor variedad de productos para ofertar, logrando así la consolidación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Adriana is the mother of two children for whom she has tirelessly struggled to support and provide them with all that they need.

With the sale of merchandise for personal hygiene she has found a way to generate good earnings while being close to her children.

Nowadays she is beginning with little capital and is in the customer gathering phase. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of wholesale products like hand cream, deodorant, lotion and wipes, among others, to in that way replenish her small business with quality products. She offers these through the use of catalogues. 

With help from this loan she can boost her business and will have a better variety of products to sell and in that way strengthen her business.

loans.use: to stock an assortment of wholesale products like hand cream, deodorant, lotion and wipes, among others, to in that way replenish her small business.

loans.name: Carmen Emilia

texts.es:
Carmen, con 64 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y es madre de 3 hijos. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, una visionaria y buena negociante. 

Siempre ha trabajado como comerciante, y tiene un almacén en el municipio de Yarumal y, desde hace 15 años tiene su propio negocio.  

Ha sabido superar tiempos difíciles en el comercio y sueña con comprarse su casa propia y tener un negocio que perdure en el tiempo; es por ello que Carmen acudió a solicitar un préstamo, el cual utilizará para comprar surtido e inventario de mercancía como artículos de belleza y papelería. 

Carmen es una mujer muy organizada aunque ha tenido que enfrentar la competencia comercial del sector.  

La suma de todos sus esfuerzos le brindan a toda su familia una calidad de vida excelente.
texts.en:
Carmen is 64 years old and lives with her life partner.  She is the mother of three children.  She is known for being a very responsible and hard-working woman, a visionary and a good negotiator.  

She has always worked as a business woman, and she has a store in the town of Yarumal.  She has had her own business for 15 years. 

She has known how to overcome difficult times for her business and her dream is to buy her own home and have a business that will last over time.  For this reason she is asking for a loan, which will be used to stock her inventory with paper products and beauty products. 

Carmen is a very organized woman. She has had to confront competition from the business sector. 

The sum of all of her efforts provides her family with an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her inventory with paper products and beauty products.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is from the town of Badian, Cebu. She is married with two children, aged seven and nine. 

For a decade now, she has been relying on raising hogs for a living. She is asking a loan from CEVI so she can buy sacks of feed and additional piglets to raise. 

Margie shared how difficult it will be for her when quality feed is not available; she will just resort to feeding her hogs with left overs and over ripe fruits, which is not enough to fatten the hogs. 

Margie plans to have a concrete barn someday to house more pigs and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Nikki Rose

texts.en:
Nikki Rose is 35 years old and mother of two children that attend school.  She works very hard to provide for her family, and has operated a general store in the Philippines for 4 years.

Nikki Rose requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items like canned goods, bread, spices, home care products, and other groceries to sell.

In the future, Nikki Rose would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items like canned goods, bread, spices, home care products, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 40 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like condiments, home care products, and other groceries. 

Rowena has been in this business for 25 years.  In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 40 years old and married with five children who are presently in school. Maricris works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products.

Maricris has been in this business for 10 years.  She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sweets for her husband's bakery.

loans.name: Jorge Emilio

texts.es: Jorge de 31 años, en compañía de su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos menores de edad reside en un barrio al sur occidente de Barranquilla, a quienes ofrece bienestar fruto de su trabajo en su taller de Calzado, esta labor la aprendió con el apoyo de un amigo dedicado a esta profesión quien le instruyo sobre cada una de las técnicas para su fabricación.  Como su familia lleva años dedicada al comercio, sus inicios laborales fueron vendiendo prendas de vestir pero consideró que debía buscar nuevos horizontes porque no podía ofertar precios competitivos.  En la actualidad cuenta con diez años de experiencia y una clientela consolidada y como su principal desafío ha sido encontrar maneras para la superación personal, está aplicando a un crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en materias primas; goma, cuero, sintéticos, suelas, plantillas y hormas, inversión que pretende mejorar su potencial para producir. A futuro desea ampliar su negocio y adquirir maquinaria.
texts.en:
Jorge is 31 years old and lives with his spouse and four minor children. He lives in a neighborhood to the southwest of Barranquilla, to which he offers the fruits of his work in his shoe shop. He learned to do this work with the support of a friend in the profession, who taught him each of the skills he uses in production. 

Since his family has been in business for years, his original work was selling clothing, but he thought it best to seek new horizons because he couldn’t offer competitive pricing.

Currently he has ten years of experience and an established clientele. His greatest challenge has been to find ways to better himself.
