He is applying for a loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will invest in raw materials: rubber, leather, synthetics, soles, insoles and shoe trees; an investment he intends to use to improve his production potential. In the future he wishes to grow his business and acquire machinery.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials: rubber, leather, synthetics, soles, insoles and shoe trees.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is 54 years old and married with one child.

Ophelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products .

Ophelia has been in this business for five years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products

loans.name: Inka Moss

texts.en: Inka Moss trains and supports small farmer suppliers in remote Andean communities to process sphagnum moss, an organic product that is highly demanded by international orchid growers for its moisture retention and disease resistance effects. For a video of how Inka Moss' works impacts Andean community, its partners and details about sphagnum moss' properties and uses watch this video. Inka Moss is looking for a loan to expand their production and collection capabilities in 15 communities in the Central Sierra region of Junin. With the loan the company plans to install seven drying beds, improve management of the land, cover the costs of needed licenses, and ensure the quality of the moss continues to meet high export standards. Inka Moss is the only company in Peru that involves remote communities in its supply chain in the collection and processing of the moss. Inka Moss buys the moss from the communities and sells it on the international market. To date, it has provided a dignified and sustainable income to more than 1,500 small farmers from 15 communities that were extremely poor. Inka Moss has also developed partnerships with the local forestry authorities and pays for a license to operate with a site management plan that takes into account ecological sustainability and land regeneration needs. To help the local producers improve the quality of their moss, Inka Moss developed an innovative on site drying bed that allows them to produce drier moss and reduce waste collection. Inka Moss received support to pilot test this new drying bed in two communities from NESsT, an organization that since 1997, has invested financing and business expertise to develop social enterprises that bring innovative solutions to alleviate poverty in emerging market countries. With these new beds, the farmers increased their yield by 15% and helped improve their production efficiency. Your support of this loan will help Inka Moss expand its reach and provide people in these remote Andean communities with a way out of poverty through a dignified and reliable source of income. Over the next five years, the company expects to reach 45,000 people in 30 communities in the high Andes.

loans.use: To expand its production and collection capabilities to continue to support the more than 1,500 small farmers in the Andes mountains

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a widowed woman, 62 years old with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Nida has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Anecita works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Anecita is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 65 years old, and she is married with 6 children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Benedicta runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy items to sell such as canned goods, bread, home care products, and other groceries.

Benedicta has borrowed and repaid one other loan from NWTF before this. She has been running her general store for 3 years, and she also earns income from selling coconut wine.

Benedicta aspires to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, bread, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 26 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products.

Perlita has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products.

loans.name: Las Chinas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario las chinas esta integrado por tres mujeres laboriosas quienes solicitan por cuarto ciclo el financiamiento de ADIM, el grupo es coordinado por Elisa de 27 años de edad, acompañada y madre de tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace seis años el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas y talladores. Con el crédito anterior logro aumentar la oferta de productos, una de sus metas es poner su propia tienda, la segunda socia es Yasmina de 38 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de productos plásticos y la tercer socia es Johanna de 34 años dedicada a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three hard-working women who are seeking the fourth loan cycle from ADIM. The group is coordinated by Elisa. She is 27 years old, has a partner and is the mother of three children. She has been selling clothes for the last six years. She will invest the loan in the purchase of shirts, pants, skirts and women’s undergarments.

With the previous loan she was able to increase her stock. One of her goals is to have her own store. The second member is Yasmina. She is 38 years old and sells plastic products. The third member is Johanna, who is 34 years old and has a traveling business selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts and women's undergarments.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander es un hombre de campo y padre de 3 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de pollos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos pollos para cría y materiales para la construcción de un galpón.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para el y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a un hombre trabajador con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Alexander is a man from the countryside and the father of 3 children for whom he has had to go through many difficulties in life. However, he has always had the strength to get ahead and continue progressing with his family.

For a while, he has wanted to undertake a business raising and selling chickens. 

For this, he has asked for a big breath of economic support to purchase some chickens to raise and materials to build a chicken coop.

With this new business, he will be able to generate income for his family who is everything for him, and he will be able to improve his wife's and children's quality of life.

He will work every day to boost his business and make it a sustainable and profitable businesses.

Support a hard-working man with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase chickens to raise and materials to build a chicken coop.

loans.name: Ma. Elvie

texts.en:
Ma. Elvie is 34 years old and married with one child.

Ma. Elvie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal-care products .

Ma. Elvie has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Ma. Elvie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal-care products

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is 43 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products.

Remy has been in this business for five years.  She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and other personal care products.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn is 21 years old with two children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Carolyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, junk foods, and other groceries.

Carolyn has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Carolyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, junk foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and a water source.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron rod coils for her son's iron chain-making business.

loans.name: Fue

texts.en:
Fue is 41 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Fue has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, cooking oil, etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. Fue will use her earnings for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar, baking powder, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Suisamoa

texts.en:
Suisamoa is a 31-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables such as cucumbers, cabbages, tomatoes, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Suisamoa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives, seeds, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Suisamoa hopes to use her profits for her children's education and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy weed sprayer, bush knives, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs. Huong is a hardworking woman and 23 years old. There are five people in her family. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family’s living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from a small business and husbandry. She is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays a daily rent because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding his children. Now his children are growing older and their needs have increased. He has been worried for many days about how to avoid paying the daily rent and has decided to buy his own rickshaw.

Lubna has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing she did not have enough money. Therefore, she has requested a loan so that her husband can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.

Lubna is a 29-year-old woman, living with her six children and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income, because now he will not pay daily rent to anyone. She is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en: For the last three years, Melchora of Badian, Cebu has been raising hogs for a living. She is a married woman with three children aged 2, 7 and 9. She works hard for them. She plans to make the most out of her business so they can have a better future through schooling. She is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed to make her hogs healthy. At the moment, she only keep her hogs under the shade of the trees. In the future, Melchora plans to build a concrete barn for her hogs to better house them.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothes for her husband's clothes selling shop.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Jelly works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Jelly is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Jelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 42 years old, married and has three children, two in school.

Rosemarie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosemarie has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband's transportation service..

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria ha tenido que soportar muchísimas adversidades en el proceso de desarrollo de su negocio.

Hoy en día vive en Yarumal y se gana la vida vendiendo ropa, cosméticos y accesorios entre otros, una actividad que aprendió de manera empírica con el afán de conseguir el sustento para su hijo.

Le dedica 4 horas diarias a su negocio.

Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de perfumería, calzado, entre otros al por mayor para tener mejor inventario.

Con este préstamo para ofrecer sus productos y mejorar sus ventas de una manera considerable.

Es una mujer fuerte y con gran espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
Maria has had to deal with many adversities in the process of developing her business.

She lives in Yarumal and earns a living selling clothing, cosmetics and accessories among other items.  She learned this occupation by doing it, with the desire to be able to support her child.

She works 4 hours a day at her business.

Maria is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of perfume and shoes among other items at wholesale in order to have a better inventory.

With this loan she will be able to provide her products and improve her sales considerably.

She is a strong woman with an impressive entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to buy perfume and shoes among other items wholesale in order to have a better inventory

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is 42 years old and a married mother of three children. She has operated a business selling milk for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken out many loans from Kashf Foundation and now is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo. That would increase milk sales, increase her income and help fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at her home to improve access to sanitation and a water source.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is a hard-working 53-year-old married mother of three children. All three have a job. Her family’s income is mainly from a small business and her husband is a woodworker. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband and her children she will be able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a water source at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for  their family.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Rafia is 35 years old and lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a small general store for five years; he offers all kinds of goods related to book depot, tailoring and cosmetics. His shop is situated in a populated area and lots of customers are available here to offer miscellaneous items to; this is the reason he keeps all kind of goods in stock. He tries to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable every day. Now he wants to offer additional bakery items such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties, etc. But the major problem is his lack of funds.

Therefore, Rafia has requested a loan from Kvia’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy additional bakery items such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties, etc. He is very glad after utilizing this loan and hopeful that he will be successful in fulfilling each request for any item and not disappoint his customers. In this way he will be able to generate maximum profit from the sale of additional bakery items and can cherish his children in a better way. Rafia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband in purchasing bakery items such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties, etc.

loans.name: Foisaga

texts.en: Foisaga is 33 years old and married with no children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Foisaga has requested a loan to buy bags of sugar, plastic paper, tongs, cash power (pre-paid electric power), etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. Foisaga will use her earnings to support her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic paper, tongs, bags of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sheema

texts.en: Sheema  has successfully built her business selling livestock such as goats with the support of Kiva and Kashf Foundation.  After purchasing small animals she raises them for a year or two and sells them in her community and earns a good amount of income. Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she was able to expand her business. Now she needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase more baby goats to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats to increase her sales

loans.name: Flordele

texts.en:
Flordele is 34 years old and single.

Flordele is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Flordele requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Flordele has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flordele would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 32 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are still in school.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Gina has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Gina aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rennie Joy

texts.en:
Rennie Joy is 22 years old and married with two children. Rennie Joy works very hard to provide for them.

Rennie Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and personal care products.

Rennie Joy has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and personal care products

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un caficultor casado con Candelaria actualmente tiene 5 hijos bajo su cargo,  los cuales depende en un 100% de los ingresos de pablo, los ingresos de pablo dependen del café que produce bajo distintos sellos de certificación y que comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, pablo está decidido a convertir su producción a 100% orgánica para lo cual la mejor opción plantar de nuevo su cafetal.
El sueño de pablo es darle a sus hijos un buen ejemplo de cómo trabajar las tierras respetando la pureza de las mismas es por eso que según nos cuenta no lo detiene nada para iniciar la conversión a orgánico.
El quiere convertir 1 hectárea a la producción orgánica y además de proteger la biodiversidad obtendrá mejores mercados y precios para su café.
Un crédito ayudara a pablo para comprar todo lo necesario en la conversión a orgánico como ser; plantas de café, abonos orgánicos, insecticidas y fungicidas orgánicos. La producción de café orgánico le permitirá obtener mejores ganancias por su café y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo is a coffee grower who is married to Candelaria and has five children under his care who are 100% dependent on Pablo's income. Pablo's income depends on coffee which he produces according to different certifications and sells through COCAFCAL as a member.

Pablo has decided to change his production to 100% organic so the best option is to plant his plantation anew. Pablo's dream is to present his children with a good example of how to work the earth with respect for it's purity. So it is for this reason that he says that nothing will stop him from converting to organic.

He wants to convert 1 hectare to organic production and besides protecting the biodiversity he can access better markets and prices for his coffee. A loan will help Pablo to buy all that is necessary to convert to organic such as : coffee plants, organic fertilizers, insecticides and organic fungicides. The organic coffee production will allow him to obtain higher profit for his coffee and improve his family's quality of living.

loans.use: to buy organic manure, pesticides, insecticides, coffee plants and pay for labor needed to convert to organic production on his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 43-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He has maintained many contacts with the customers over the years. She is a mother of four sons and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing, and health expenses.

Nazia wants to financially help the growth of her husband’s general store and requested a loan from Kiva's field partner's BRAC Pakistan. Now, her husband can buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan; she is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in the earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventories for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 41 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Gina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Gina would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is 41 years old and single.

Rochelle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and personal care products.

Rochelle has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a flower shop, buy-and-sell dried fish and charcoal retailing.

Rochelle aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and personal care products

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresita is 44 years old and has one child still in school.

Teresita has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt, fish net and other materials for her business.

Teresita has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt, fish net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Rosemy

texts.en:
Rosemy is 44 years old and married with two children.

Rosemy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and personal care products.

Rosemy has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rosemy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and personal care products

loans.name: Joymie

texts.en:
Joymie is a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Joymie has a buy-and-sell beauty and home product-care business in the Philippines. Joymie requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Joymie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Joymie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, etc.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a married mother of 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 29 years old, and 4 of her children go to school.

Beverly has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more inventory of groceries to sell.

Beverly has been in this business for 4 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to both expand her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Rios De Aguaviva Group

texts.es:
Juana (es la señora ubicada en la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) es una mujer que trabaja con la mente puesta en un mejor futuro para sus hijos,  es por ello que día con día se esfuerza para alcanzar sus metas, ella tiene 51 años vive junto a sus cuatro hijos en una comunidad de Sololá.
Juana es una mujer que le gusta la tratar con la gente pues hace 10 años ella decidió buscar una actividad donde pudiera generar algo de ingresos  y desde ese entonces ella trabaja atendiendo su pequeño molino de nixtamal, gracias a este servicio que Juana presta las mujeres de su comunidad ya no sufren mucho cundo necesitan moler su nixtamal y con la poca ganancia que genera con su molino ella apoya a sus hijos con los gastos de la escuela.
Juana viendo el gran beneficio que su molino de nixtamal le da a ella y a sus vecinas, se ve a la necesidad de comprar ahora un afilador de discos para seguir moliendo la mejor masa y que las mujeres con ella preparen las deliciosas tortillas, pero una de las dificultades que tiene Juana es no contar con el dinero entonces ahora junto a un grupo de señoras está solicitando un préstamo para poder adquirir su afilador.
El gran sueño de Juana es poder comprar otro molino para prestar mejor sus servicios a la gente.
texts.en:
Juana (the woman pictured to the right in the photo) is a woman that works with a mindset of a better future for her children. For that reason, she strives day-by-day to reach her goals. She is 51 years old and lives with her four children in a community of Sololá. Juana likes dealing with people, so 10 years ago she decided to look for a job where she could gain some money and from that point on she has worked tending her little corn mill. Thanks to this service that she gives to the women in her community, they do not suffer as much when they need to mill their corn. With the little earnings that she gets with her mill, she supports her children with the school expenses. 

Upon seeing the great benefit that her corn mill gives her and her neighbors, Juana sees the necessity to now buy a disc grinder to continue to grind the best dough that the women then use to prepare delicious tortillas. One of the difficulties that Juana has is not having money. So now, with a group of women, she is asking for a loan to be able to purchase her grinder. Juana's big dream is to be able to buy another mill to better lend her services to people.

loans.use: to buy a disc grinder for a corn mill.

loans.name: Lluvia Group

texts.es: Grupo Lluvia está integrado por tres mujeres laboriosas coordinado por doña Lorena de 41 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos que con sus esfuerzos logro sacarlos adelante y hoy son mayores de edad e independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y frijoles cocidos desde hace 14 años, solicita por quinceava vez  crédito en ADIM para la compra de maíz, cal, leña, frijoles, ajo y sal, con los créditos anteriores logro realizar unas mejoras en su casa, la segunda socia es flor de 45 años quien se dedica a la venta de comida y la tercer socia es Jessenia de 19 años quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa usada.
texts.en:
Grupo Lluvia is made up of three hard-working women coordinated by Dona Lorena.  She is 41 years old, a single mother of two children who, through her efforts, she succeeded in raising and supporting. They are now adults and independent.  She has worked selling tortillas and cooked beans for 14 years.  She is requesting her fifteenth loan with ADIM to buy corn, lime powder, firewood, beans, garlic and salt.  With her previous loans she succeeded in making improvements to her house. 

The second member is Flor.  She is 45 years old and works selling food.  The third member is Jessenia.  She is 19 years old and works selling cosmetics and second-hand clothing.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, firewood, beans, garlic and salt

loans.name: Mee Group

texts.en:
Khamon’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Khamon and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan, which made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  

Khamon and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years. Within this 2 years filter users, like Khamon’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Reyes

texts.es:
REYES TIENE 53 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVIENTE, CON 01 HIJO A SU CARGO, VIVE JUNTO A SU FAMILIA EN EL CASERIO TAURANA DISTRITO DE PUCARA,PROVINCIA DE JAEN, REGION CAJAMARCA, SIERRA NORTE DE PERU. EL CASERIO DE TAURANA ES UN CASERIO PEQUEÑO EL CUAL SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO A UNOS 30 MINUTOS LOMA ARRIBA DEL DISTRITO DE PUCARA EN DICHO CASERIO LA POBLACION SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA MAYORMENTE AL CULTIVO DE PIÑA Y CAFE, CASERIO PEQUEÑO Y TRABQUILO.

REYES SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA BASICAMENTE A LOS CULTIVOS DE PIÑA CUENTA CON 02 HA DE PLANTACIONES DE PIÑA,ADEMAS SE DEDICA A CULTIVO DE CAFÉ Y PAN LLEVAR, CON EXPERCIENCIA DE MAS DE 13 AÑOS, EL DESTINO DE CREDITO ES PARA INVERTIR EN DESHIERBOS DE SU FINCA DE PIÑA ASÍ COMO ABONOS PARA EL MANTENIMIENTO DE LA MISMA, DE ESTA MANERA PODRÁ INVIRTIR EN SU NEGOCIO Y PODER ADQUIRIR UNA MAYOR UTILIDAD PARA QUE MEJORE SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
53-year old Reyes is married and supports a son. He lives with his family in the village of Taurana, Pucara Dustrict, located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region of Peru’s northern sierra. The village is small and quiet, and is located on a hillside 30 minutes from the district of Pucara. The local people work in agriculture growing for the most part pineapples and coffee. 

Reyes also grows pineapples on his 2-hectare plantation as well as coffee and breadfruit, and has more than 13 years' experience in agriculture.

He plans to use the loan money to buy herbicide and compost for his pineapple crop. By investing in his fields he will be able to to earn more money and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: buy herbicide and compost for his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Verde Sonrisa Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario verde sonrisa está conformado por cuatro mujeres laboriosas, coordinado por la joven Jessica de 25 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos quienes  son su mayor motivación, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de cepillos de lavar ropa desde hace cuatro años, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado mantener el negocio y cumplir con los planes de pago, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de tacos de madera, nylon y alambre, una de sus metas es poner un negocio de venta de ropa, la segunda socia es Janeth de 35 años de edad propietaria de la fábrica de cepillos, la tercer socia es carolina quien se dedica a la venta de cepillos y Lisseth  de 20 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa y perfumes.
texts.en:
This dedicated group of four hardworking women is called Verde Sonrisa. 25-year old Jessica is the coordinator. She is married and has two children who are her prime motivation for working hard. She has made and sold scrubbing brushes for four years. With previous loans she has managed to continue her business and make the repayments. 

Now Jessica is seeking a loan to buy blocks of wood, nylon, and wire. One of her goals is to open a business selling clothing.

A second group member is 35-year old Janeth who owns a brush factory. Then there are Carolina who sells brushes, and 20-year old Lisseth who sells clothing and perfume.

loans.use: buy blocks of wood, nylon, and wire

loans.name: Lourdis Arlin

texts.en:
Lourdis Arlin is 46 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdis Arlin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lourdis Arlin has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Lourdis Arlin would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Velhina

texts.en:
Velhina is 60 years old, widowed, and has one child.

Velhina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and personal care products.

Velhina has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from selling dried fish.

Velhina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, soap, sugar, eggs, bread and personal care products

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, inicio con un negocio de arreglo de uñas y cepillado de cabello prestando su servicio a domicilio en el municipio de Yarumal, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de esmaltes de uñas de diferentes colores y otros insumos para el arreglo de uñas así podrá prestar un mejor servicio y podrá mantener a flote su servicio.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Diana a continuar con su proyecto de vida!
texts.en:
Diana, in her restless pursuit of a better life and better economic stability, started a business of nail grooming and hair brushing, loaning her home services in the city of Yarumal. It is a city where drive and tenacity are important models to the people who live there. Diana works every day with varied schedules and she is always busy with some service or another because she is very sought after for her good work. 

She is asking for an economic aide to buy nail polishes in different colors and other supplies for nail grooming. This way she will be able to give a better service and will be able to keep her business afloat. Nowadays, she feels happy for the good work that she has done up until now and which has allowed her to enjoy a more stable job. With the loan, you will be supporting Diana to continue with her life project!

loans.use: to buy nail polishes in different colors and other supplies for nail grooming.

loans.name: Marlenny Amparo

texts.es:
En la pintura y escultura encuentran muchas personas una oportunidad para progresar y salir delante de una manera humilde y con mucho coraje, tal es el caso de Marleny que a sus 32 años es una mujer con gran talento y pasión por este arte.
Crea hermosas y variadas obras de arte en barro.
Con este negocio intenta sacar a su familia adelante ya que es una forma muy honrada de hacerlo, y como dice ella “el oficio de pintura y cerámica le gusta mucho, y quiero seguir estudiando en el SENA y aprender más”

Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de pintura y herramientas para pintar, los cuales le permitirán continuar su oficio con el cual ha intentado obtener algunos ingresos.

Una de las grandes dificultades que ha tenido que enfrentar es la falta de oportunidades para crecer y desarrollarse como artista, pero poco a poco intentara tener una vida mejor.

Apoya a Marleny con su arte y haz que su vida sea mejor con un préstamo.
texts.en:
In painting and sculpture, many people find an opportunity to progress and get ahead in a humble way and with a lot of courage. Such is the case of Marleny, who is 32 years old and a woman with great talent and passion for this art. She creates beautiful and varied works of clay art. With this business, she tries to support her family because it is a very honorable way to do so. As she says, "I really like the craft of painting and ceramics, and I want to continue studying at SENA and learn more." 

She is asking for economic help to buy paint and painting tools, which will allow her to continue with her craft that she has tried to earn an income with. One of the biggest difficulties that she has had to deal with is the lack of opportunities to grow and develop as an artist, but little-by-little she is trying to have a better life. Support Marleny with her art and make her life better with this loan.

loans.use: to buy paint and painting tools, which will allow her to continue with her craft that she has tried to earn an income with.

loans.name: Phan Group

texts.en:
Cheam understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Cheam knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Cheam purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Cheam is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 40 years old and married with three children. With her three children in school, Lucena works very hard to provide for them.

Lucena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Lucena has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Lucena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures.

Rosenie dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vivian is 44 years old and has children who are still in school.

Vivian has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Vivian requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like cloths, needles and thread for her business.

Vivian has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like clothes, needles and thread for her business

loans.name: Metchelin

texts.en:
Metchelin is 45 years old with one child in school. Metchelin works very hard to provide for them.

Metchelin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Metchelin has been in this business for 7 years. 

In the future, Metchelin would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Amelita dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: See Group

texts.en:
Thongdam is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Thongdam and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.

The water filter Thongdam and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years, but is known to function for up to five years. Thongdam and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And, after totaling up the costs, Thongdam and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband in purchasing new tires for reselling.

loans.name: Renelda

texts.en:
Renelda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Renelda is 49 years old and has one child in school.

Renelda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Renelda requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Renelda has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Renelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Khong Group

texts.en: Bang understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Bang knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Bang purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.   Bang is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es:
Odilia, radicada zona rural del municipio de Victoria, siempre se ha desempeñado en el sector agropecuario al lado de su familia donde aprendió estos menesteres. 

Lleva unos meses con su propia cría de cerdos de engorde para la venta y distribución en varias zonas del su pueblo. 

Sueña con mejorar el número de cerdos para criar y solicitó a la Corporación Interactuar un crédito con el que adquirirá varios Porcinos y los insumos para la alimentación y sostenimiento de estos.

Las ganancias obtenidas por el aumento de sus animales será mucho mayor lo que le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de vida sin tanta dificultad económica.

De este negocio dependen sus dos hijos.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una casa propia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Odilia comes from the rural area of the municipality of Victoria. She has always earned her living in agriculture and livestock raising alongside her family who taught her these skills. For some months now she has had her own pigs to raise and fatten and then sell in various parts of town.

Odilia's goal is to increase the number of pigs she is raising. She is seeking a loan from Corporación Interactuar to buy several pigs and the feed she requires to raise them. The money she earns from expanding her business will increase and she will be able to have a better standard of living with no financial problems. Her two children depend on the success of her business

Her greatest dream is to have a house of her own and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy several pigs and the feed she needs to raise them

loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eve is 55 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in a rural village on the island of Savaii in Samoa. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as canned food, frozen goods, sugar, soft drinks, and snacks. She has been running her business for 3 years now. 

Eve became a microloan borrower with SPBD in 2008 and has successfully borrowed and repaid 8 loans. With her first loan of about US $250 Eve started a small pancake and ice cake business. Based on her successful history, Eve has become eligible for a small business loan. 

She wishes to use this loan to extend her store. In the past, Eve has used the profits from her business to help pay for her children's education. In the future, Eve hope to improve her business by investing in a gas oven to bake biscuits to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, freezer, sacks of flour, sugar, rice, boxes of tinned fish and other goods

loans.name: Nhóm 08 Minh Hùng Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Diệp is 33 years old and she is married.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 6 years. Diệp lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Diệp faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

In 2013, Diệp joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Diệp has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Diệp hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 01 - Phố Triệu Quốc Đạt - Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiên is 39 years old and she is married.
 
She has had a retail business selling paint for more than 10 years.  Hiên lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Hiên faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more paint to resell.

In 2012, Hiên joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hiên has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Hiên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more paint to resell

loans.name: Luis Heiser

texts.es:
Luis Heiser tiene 30 años de edad, conviviente, con 4 hijos a su cargo , vive en casa familiar; domiciliado en el distrito de Oyotún, Provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, Costa norte del Perú.

Él se dedica a brindar servicio de albañilería; hace 3 años,con buenas refrencia. Negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, solicita préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo; compra de herramientas como son tablas,carretillas,entre otros para su trabajo esto con la finalidad de brindar mejores servicio a sus clientes y que se generen mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Heiser is 30 years old, partnered, with 4 children in his care. He lives in the family home in the district of Oyotún, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

He has worked offering carpentry services for the past 3 years with good references. The business is located in his home. He asks for a loan to invest in working capital, to purchase tools such as boards, carts, and more, for his work, with the end of offering better customer service and generating more income to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase tools such as boards, carts, and others for his work

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 50 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Melinda has a general store business in the Philippines. Melinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Melinda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Melinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband in purchasing various color clothing for reselling.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 55 years old with two children. Rosario works very hard to provide for them.

Rosario runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Rosario has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Rosario would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyet is a hardworking woman, 63 years old. There are four people in her family. 

The loan can help her to build a new latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from livestock farm. 

With more than 30 years experience and has support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a new latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en:
Brigitte is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Brigitte needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, oven, pot, shopping bags and vegetable oil. 

She plans to use her profits to support her family and to save more for her children's education. 

Brigitte has been a member of SPBD since May this year (2015) to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, oven, pot, shopping bags and vegetable oil

loans.name: Siiae

texts.en:
Siiae is a single, 19-year-old lady. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. 

To do this she needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, oven, shopping bags and vegetable oil. 

In the future, Siiae hopes to expand her business and to support her family financially. 

She joined SPBD in May this year (2015) to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, oven, shopping bags and vegetable oil

loans.name: Moto

texts.en:
Moto is 28 years old and married with 1 child. She runs a small business selling snacks, drinks, donuts, bread and more in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Moto has requested a loan to buy snacks, drinks, a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, a bag of rice and a cooler. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Moto will save more for unexpected emergencies and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy snacks, drinks, a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, a bag of rice and a cooler

loans.name: Shirelyn

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Shirelyn works hard to support her family. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling personal care products. 

Shirelyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in the market for her fruit vending business.

Shirelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in the market

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alona is 46 years old and has three children who are in school.

Alona has a general store business in the Philippines. Alona requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks groceries to sell.

Alona has been in this business for two years. In the future, Alona would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vilma has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. 

Vilma requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, etc..

Vilma has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts, etc.

loans.name: Floribeth

texts.es: Floribeth  tiene la edad de 38 años, está en unión libre y vive con tres hijos y el esposo actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de mercadería como arroz,fréjoles,azúcar,aceite,manteca,masa,atunes entre otros productos para una pulpera .Ella espera poder aumentar las ventas y ganar más clientes. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Floribeth is 38 years old, lives with her partner and with her three children. She wants the loan to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, butter, tuna, and others for her food store. She hopes to be able to increase her sales and gain more customers. In the future she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater financial stability, and she hopes to keep growing. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has provided her with a loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, butter, tuna, and others for her food store.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 51 years old and has four children, who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. Belinda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her chicken.

Belinda has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her chickens

loans.name: Ana Raquel

texts.es:
Ana, en su mente lo único que tiene presente es que para salir adelante hay que trabajar duramente y mantenerse siempre fuerte ante las adversidades que se puedan presentar.

Por esta razón, todos los días labora de una manera firme pero sin dejar a un lado su gran sonrisa y carisma que le han permitido ganarse un lugar desde hace 10 años cuando decidió abrir su negocio de comidas en el municipio de Sincelejo.

En su negocio ofrece alimentos variados, los cuales son muy apetecidos por los clientes que visitan regularmente su negocio.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de insumos como carne, pollo, verduras, lacteos, entre otros para abastecer su restaurante, adicionalmente necesita arreglar su estufa.

Ella sabe que de la mano de interactuar y con el apoyo de los prestamistas de KIVA podrá tener un negocio muy bien acreditado y con la mejor estabilidad posible.
texts.en:
The only thing on Ana's mind is that, in order to get ahead, she needs to work hard and stay always strong in the face of adversities that may come up.

For this reason, she works with determination every day, but without setting aside her great smile and charisma. These have enabled her to earn herself a place since 10 years ago, when she decided to open her food business in the municipality of Sincelejo.

At her business, she offers various foods, which are very sought after by her customers that regularly visit her business.

She is asking for economic support to purchase ingredients such as meat, chicken, vegetables, dairy products, and other items to stock her restaurant. She also needs to fix her stove.

She knows that, with the help of Interactuar and the support of Kiva lenders, she will be able to have a well-recognized business with the best stability possible.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, chicken, vegetables, dairy products and others to stock her restaurant, and to fix her stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy designs and delightful colors clothing for her husband's clothing shop.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 41 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Wilma is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Wilma has been in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 58 years old, married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Charito has a food vending business in the Philippines. Charito requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Charito has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Charito would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture, crockery and food items for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Samoana

texts.en:
Samoana is a 49-year-old woman who is married, with 10 children. She runs a business of sewing clothes in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Samoana has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, materials, needles, thread, etc. 

She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needles, thread, materials, etc.

loans.name: 03 - Quang Trung - Phường Đông Hương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thắng is 59 years old and she is a single parents. Her husband was died, Thắng has to work so hard to take care her children.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.  Thắng lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Although her family is a low-income household in village, she was a reputable person in the community. Thắng is group leader of the 03 - Quang Trung - Phường Đông Hương solidarity group.

The main hardship that Thắng faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.
This is Thắng's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Thắng hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to buy a new motobike for her child go to work.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Selea

texts.en:
Selea is a 32 years old married woman with 2 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Selea needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar, vegetable oil, oven and baking soda. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies. Selea has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar, vegetable oil, oven and baking soda

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is 58 years old. She is known in the Oroquieta area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Nhóm 13 Nam Sơn 1, Phường Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nguyên is 63 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling cake, sweet, suger, milk, etc... and general things for more than 10 years.Nguyên lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral cause can't get loan from other banks or credit institutions.

The main hardship that Nguyên faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweet, suger, milk, etc... to resell.

In 2010, Nguyên joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Nguyên has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Nguyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweet, sugar, milk and general things... to resell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. There she has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services."

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jury

texts.en:
Jury is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jury is 45 years old and has one child still in school.

Jury has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jury has been in this business for four years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amelia is 37 years old and has five children who are in school.

Amelia has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Amelia requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Amelia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Amelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 62 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Julie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Julie has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Norys Isabel

texts.es:
Norys, de 56 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella se desempeña como confeccionista de distintas prendas tales como pijamas, camisetas y ropa interior.

Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento ya que es soltera.

Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada, siempre en busca de oportunidades para progresar y mejorar como empresaria.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar tela e hilos que le permitan mejorar su nivel de producción y poder aumentar sus ventas.

De esta forma podría solventar todos sus gastos y podría tener esa vida plena que tanto ha soñado.
texts.en:
Norys is 56 years old, she has a very clear idea about what she wants in life and is determined to achieve it and have a good life. 

Norys makes a living as a dressmaker of different items of clothing such as pyjamas, shirts and underwear.

This work was started when Norys was looking for a way to make enough money to take care of herself as a single person. She is very hard-working and disciplined, always looking for opportunities to develop and improve her business. 

Norys is seeking a loan to buy material and thread to increase production and sales. This would allow her to pay for living costs and to have the life that she has dreamed of.

loans.use: to buy material and thread to increase production and sales.

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len works hard to support her family. She is single with one child and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Len requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

She has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rithy's Group

texts.en:
Rithy is a 50-year-old mother of three children, all of whom are in school They are living in Battambang province. The sources of her family’s income are from tailoring clothes for a fee and work as a construction worker. She has been involved in these businesses for 25 years. Her daily income is about 29,200KHR and she is able to save around 14,000KHR per day for emergency needs. 

Rithy has been with VisionFund for six cycles already and completely paid back the past loans. The previous loans helped her to improve her family’s living and have enough consumption for her family. 

Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy a roof to repair her old house. 

She hopes to have a better house to stay in and earn more income to support her children’s studying.

loans.use: to repair her old house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de ahora 48 años de edad, él está profundamente agradecido por el apoyo que recibió con el crédito anterior pues gracias a ello él pudo comprar sus materiales para la producción de miel, afortunadamente esta inversión que el realizo lo ayudo de gran manera que poco a poco sus cajas de miel han incrementado, y sus ingresos han mejorado,  Miguel gracias a los años que lleva de ser socio de ADICLA el confía plenamente en ella porque es una institución que lo a poyado mucho el  ahora nuevamente tiene la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para  seguir incrementado su producción de miel el con el crédito comprara azúcar, cera, y estampado de tablas.
Miguel sueña con poder incrementar su producción con este nuevo préstamo para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is a man of 48. He is profoundly grateful for the support he's received with the previous loan, as thanks to it, he was able to buy his materials for the production of honey. Fortunately the investment he made helped him greatly and his number of hives has little by little increased, and his income has improved. 

Thanks to the years Miguel has been a part of ADICLA, he has complete trust in it, because it is an institution that has helped him a great deal. Now he again has the need to apply for a loan to continue increasing his production of honey and he will use the loan to buy sugar, wax, and wooden frames.

Miguel dreams of being able to increase his production with this new loan so that he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wax and wooden frames  for producing honey.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for her husband's iron manufacturing business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending.

Alicia dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 - Business Club Group

texts.en:
Mrs Mùi has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice to resell.  She is 47 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Mùi is the group leader of the nhóm 01 - business club solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

This is Mùi first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Mùi has been involved in this business for 6 years.
The main hardship that Mùi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mùi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn Thái Sơn 2 Xã Công Chính Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa is 44 years old and she is married.
 
She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years.Hoa lives in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Hoa faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase fish and shrimp to resell.

In 2014, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hoa has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase fish and shrimp to resell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As the married mother of seven children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a selling flowers business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Alma is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more flowers and resell.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more flowers and resell.

loans.name: Iulia

texts.en:
Iulia is a 28 years old woman who is married with 1 child. She runs a business sewing and painting clothes in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

Iulia has requested a loan to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, elei boards and design. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and support her family . She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, elei boards and designs

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 66 years old, married and has five children.

Clarita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Clarita requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Clarita has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 40 years old and married.

Adela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of goods to sell.

Adela has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Adela aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of goods to sell.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is 45 years old, married, a vigorous lady. She is a mother of 4 children.  She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute in the family income.
