She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life.

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales

loans.name: Grupo Miurel Group

texts.es: Grupo Miurel esa integrado por dos mujeres laboriosas y un microempresario emprendedor, es coordinado por la joven Miurel de 20 años de edad, soltera y dedicada a la venta de ropa y carteras de segunda mano desde hace tres años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de pantalones, camisas, cartera y sabanas. Uno de sus metas es promover el negocio con el aumento de variedades de ropa, con el crédito anterior logro poner un salón de belleza, el segundo socio es William de 29 años quien se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos nuevos y usados y la tercer socia es doña María de 50 años de edad que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de nacatamales y pupusas.
texts.en:
Grupo Miurel is made up of two hard-working women and one entrepreneurial small business owner. 
The group is coordinated by Miurel, a young person who is 20 years old and single. She has worked selling second hand clothing and wallets for three years. She is requesting the loan to buy pants, shirts, wallets and bed sheets. One of her goals is to promote her business by increasing the variety of clothing that she sells. 
With the previous loan she was able to set up a beauty salon.
The second member of the group is William. He is 29 years old and works selling new and used household appliances. The third member is María. She is 50 years old and she works making and selling nacatamles (corn, meat and rice wrapped in a banana leaf) and stuffed tortillas.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, wallets and bed sheets.

loans.name: 11- Tây Ga - Phú Sơn1 Group

texts.en:
Mrs Đông is 50 years old and she is married with 1 child.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Đông lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village.

The main hardship that Đông faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.
This is Đông first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Đông hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Fritz Andrew

texts.en:
Fritz Andrew  is 26 years old residing at Dipolog. He is single and has venture in buy and sell of RTW business. 

Recently, he is accessing a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional buy and sell shoes to sell in the local community.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of shoes

loans.name: Ma. Marieta

texts.en:
Ma. Marieta is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Marieta is 49 years old and has five children who are in school.

Ma. Marieta has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Marieta requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Ma. Marieta has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Ma. Marieta would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 56 years old and has nine children. Evangeline is married and has two children who are in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Evangeline has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a married woman, 50 years old with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Daisy has a fishing business in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish net, gasoline and other materials for her business.

Daisy has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets, gasoline and other materials for her business

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hazel is 25 years old and has three children who are in school.

Hazel has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Hazel requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell .

Hazel has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Hazel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en:
Hanifan is a 45-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan and is the mother of one son, two daughters. Her husband is engaged in a scrap material recycling business.

Hanifan's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle, but due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to make the bulk purchase. Therefore, Hanifan has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan will enable Hanifan's husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can earn a good profit from his business.

Hanifan is very thankful to Kiva's lenders and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy recycle material in bulk for her husband's recycle material selling & purchasing business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine is 49 years old and has one child still in school.

Josephine has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items of dry goods to sell in her stall.

Josephine has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of dry goods to sell in her stall

loans.name: Hon

texts.en:
Mrs. Hon is 29 years old. She is married and has two children, so she works very hard to provide for them. Small business is the main income of her family. 

With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family living standard as well as environment protection.

loans.use: To build a new latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una mujer con gran empuje y emprendimiento, desde hace un tiempo se determino a encontrar una actividad que le generar buenos ingresos y que le permitiera ser independiente, es así como desde hace 8 años inicio con un negocio de venta de bebidas, billares y juegos de azar en el municipio de Sincelejo.

Es un negocio bastante popular en el sector y se ha convertido en punto de encuentro para adultos.

Con este tiempo en el mercado ya tiene cierto nivel de reconocimiento gracias a la buena gestión de Maribel.

El solicita un préstamo para realizar una mejora a su mesa de billar y comprara surtido de bebidas alcohólicas ya que quiere hacerla mucho más atractiva y cómoda para sus clientes.

Ella ofrece trabajo a una persona y desea generar otros empleos.
texts.en:
Maribel is a very driven and enterprising woman. 

Some time ago she decided to find an activity that would generate a good income that would allow her to be independent. This is how she came to start a business of selling drinks, billiards and gambling 8 years ago in the city of Sincelejo.

Her business is very popular in her area and has become a meeting place for adults.  With this time in the market her business has become well known, thanks to Maribel's good management.  

She is requesting the loan to buy a better pool table and a supply of alcoholic beverages, as she wants her business to be more attractive and comfortable for her customers. 

She employs one person and would like to have more employees in the future.

loans.use: to a better pool table and a supply of alcoholic drinks.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old and married with seven children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, Elena has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as bread, beverages, canned good, biscuits, noodles, and other groceries.

Elena is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, eggs, personal care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, junk foods, eggs, personal care products, and other groceries
